Reviews.Title: “Istanbul-Crossroads of History, Culture,and Religion”
Reviews.Author: somone
Reviews.Content: First off, the Four Seasons Bosphorus is a converted Sultan's Palace. Yes, it was that great. Less than a week ago, we walked out on the massive porch and were greeted with the most spectacular view of Bosphorus. This is probably the most historic waterway in the world. History and culture were passing before us and we could touch the water. One morning I relaxed in the warm whirlpool and watched the Bosphorus wake up. On the final morning before we had to catch our flight, we delighted in the brunch and enjoyed the glimmering Bosphorus and, along with the dolphins, watched ferries, water taxis, shipping vessels, tour boats, naval craft, and the water craft of the rich and famous. We bought a Turkish tapestry in the carpet museum in the Hotel. No pressure, just great service. The room, staff and amenities were five star as one would expect with rates listed with three zeros instead of two. This trip actually fell out of the sky for my wife and I, just like we had rubbed the Aladdin's lamp. Sometimes life treats you better than you could ever imagine. Lest I forget, we had instant access to one of the most magical cities in the world. One tip, we took the water taxi from the Four Seasons Bosporus to the Four Seasons Sultanhmet in the old city. This is where it is at, the crossroads of 3,000 years of history, culture and religion. The water taxi avoided all the cabs and traffic.It was the tulip festival in Istanbul. The picture is the park pretty much across the street from the Four Seasons Bosporus. I don't know, did I just wake up from a dream?

Reviews.Title: “expansive, but really an outstanding place”
Reviews.Author: theoneandonlyArnold
Reviews.Content: brilliant setting, perfect service, perfect quality of rooms and all hotel facilities. terrace at bosphorus is brilliant. and all this has its price...

Reviews.Title: “If you can afford it”
Reviews.Author: aussieNewYork
Reviews.Content: We shifted from the ritz to the four seasons and it took a little adjustment. It is a more formal environment which can be less relaxing. Rooms were normal standard and the location was superb on the bosphorous. The things we loved were the spa which was brilliant and the pool was levels above the ritz. Breakfast buffet was excellent , expensive of course, but we had dinner at he aqua and treated my son to some ribs (36 usd) and they were disappointing. We went down the road to ortakoy via taxi, the next night to the "House cafe" near the jazz club (where hilary kole was playing) and enjoyed dinner there. We took the ferry to the old city via the ferry system to asia and back which was great but the concierge gave us some bad advice to get to Minaturk on ferry. Guess not many four season guests use the ferry system. In the end, it was a memorable stay. Taxis seem to have easier access to the hotel than the ritz which is actually quite important for the quality of the service. It was a palace and still is in my view. So an experience if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: d_home883
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel in an excellent location. The room was large, beautifully furnished and appointed. Very comfortable bed with new linens. Everything looks clean and brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel by the water”
Reviews.Author: derrsi
Reviews.Content: The biggest attraction at this hotel is a fantastic large terrace next to the Bosphorus that offers views across to Asia and up towards the Sultanahmet area. It is spectacular and also a bit of tranquility in a hectic city (well, it was on a cold March evening - it may also be full of people in summer!). The hotel itself is a beautiful old building with modern wings. The rooms are spacious and well laid out. Staff and friendly and service in general is excellent. The food was good, although the choice of restaurants within the hotel is limited to a bar menu, a Mediterranean restaurant or room service. Other than the Bosphorus front, the location is ok but there are better places to be from a tourist perspective if you want to be near the big attractions. Given the traffic it can take a while to get around, but in a city the size of Istanbul it isn't possible to have a location that is convenient for everything. A good choice for business or couples. There weren't any children around when I stayed, so hard to say whether it is ok for families.

Reviews.Title: “Because you're worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Clanmc
Reviews.Content: First impression of the Bosphorus 4 seasons was not wholly favourable. We have often looked at 4 seasons hotels and ended up booking others on the basis of price vs quality and lack of discounts - everyone loves a bargain. For the first 12 hours I thought we had it right. Public areas were impressive but room very nice but not outstanding but with good bed and bathroom. Service good but not exceptional - limited water in room despite tap drinking advice in Istanbul. Breakfast solid but obviously very expensive - slightly going through the motions rather than anything exceptional and not very Turkish. However, it would be an understatement to say that the hotel grew on us. The position and view really is stunning and sitting having a coffee by the water a truly memorable experience. The spa is first class with great pool and steam room - we had a mixed hammam and it was extraordinarily good. In addition, the staff, particularly at the door and the concierge could not have been more helpful. If you can afford it, don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Melinda W
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here after coming back from Izmir before flying home the next day. We had stayed at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet at the beginning of our visit to Turkey. We preferred the Sultanahmet hotel. The service here at the Bosphorus location was superb. As you would expect from Four Seasons. The hotel is beautiful. The out door area is expansive & covered in marble. Very beautiful right on the water. It was not warm enough to sit outside but on a nice day, it would be a great place to sit & have lunch out enjoy a cocktail. The outdoor pool is also lovely but was not being maintained when we were there. It was dirty & needed cleaning before the season starts. Out room was quite large. We had our 21 year old daughter with us & decided on our last night we would opt for just 1 room. We were upgraded to a garden view room - but if they consider the room we had "garden view" then I am glad we didn't pay extra for it. We overlooked the entrance to the hotel. It does have a "garden" area in front of the hotel but what really catches your eye is all the cars pulling in & the traffic on the street. It is on a very busy street. But the room itself was nice. We had a roll away bed in the room & we still had plenty of room to move around. There was a desk & chair and a sitting chair with still plenty of room, so a very large room. There is a window seat also which was a nice feature. The room did seem a little dated or just in need of some better decor. It was plain. Overall it is a nice place but not on par with the Sultanahmet location.

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't come any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: ___Dr__J0Hn___
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at the Four Seasons Istanbul at the Bosphorus for 5 nights. I was attending a conference held at the Lutfi Kirdar Convention Centre. I must admit, I had some initial second thoughts about choosing the Four Seasons when I saw the proximity of other hotels such as the Hilton and Intercontinental to the Convention Centre which would have made going to the conference each day more convenient. However, the experience of staying at the Four Seasons more than compensated for the short distance travelled to the conference daily. This hotel sets a standard that would be the envy of most luxury hotels. As you know, the location is simply stunning, even in winter, with intimate Bosphorus views. The level of service was outstanding: all the staff knew my name, even the ones I hadn't met! I would like to comment on two things in particular: The spa, sauna, relaxation rooms, gym facilites were incredible. Most commercial gymnasiums would not compare to the quality of the equipment provided. Secondly, the manager on duty approached us as we leaving to ask for feedback about our stay. I do not think this was paying lip service, but rather a genuine enquiry about our experience at the hotel, and a desire on their part to know how they can continue to fine tune their product. Very impressive. I would rate this as one of the best luxury hotel experiences I have ever had, and have no hesitation in recommending it to you.

Reviews.Title: “A dream stay!”
Reviews.Author: condottiero
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul for Christmas and everything was wonderful! The views from the room were exquisite and the attention great!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: parmaham8
Reviews.Content: we stayed 2 day,s in May 2011. the hotel is very romantic , and the restaurant was excellant Italian cuisine, although we were really craving for some really good turkish food after 3 weeks on a French cruise ship..the bar does serve turkish style tapas for want of a better word . it,s a good 15/ 20 minute cab ride from the centre of town , but it,s great to be able to hop on a boat at the front of the hotel and cruise the bosphorus. we loved the tranquility away from the crowds in the centre of town , and we would stay here again for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Fabulous; Even the Departure”
Reviews.Author: Venamo
Reviews.Content: It may read strangely to start a fabulous review by saying"...the3 best part of our stay was leaving..." but the perfect departure just underscored the visit and the management of th. property. I am used toe Four Seasons providing good "meet and greets'. They had done a seemless move from Sultanahmet; not check in nor front desk; but this was even better. The BMW 750 with an intelligent well spoken driver whisked us to the airport. Usual. Theen suddenly he called a concierge at the airport who met us with a porter and the next thing we knew we were at customs leaving. No lines no hassles. In a new , for us, airport with an unfamiliar layout and signs in a strange language, I can not tell you how hassle free this was. A perfect end to a perfect stay. After being immersed in the historic old section of Istanbul it was a good contrast to be on the wide waterway; watching life and commerce flow by. Breakfast, lunch and dinner; not to mention drinks along the Bosphorus; even one afternoon by the pool, sunning in the beautiful summer sun. The rooms were big and well done with a flair. My only complaint is the large windows did not open. They were latched to control the a/c so one could not throw them open and stand on the french balcony. A shame. Our room faced the Bosphorus in the main building. Not certain if the buildings behind our hotel were condos or other rooms, but would want to be where we were.

Reviews.Title: “A dream on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Sophia S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August of 2011. When I arrived at the airport I realized that my travel agent accidentally booked us into the Bosphorus rather than the Sultanahmet. I was actually very happy that he did. After hot and humid days touring Istanbul the only thing my children wanted to do is lay and relax by the pool. The Sultanahmet however did not have a pool. The bosphorus was an amazing environment. It may be slightly far from the sights yet staying at this hotel was sure a better choice over the Sultanahmet. Our room faced onto the Bosphorus and the atmosphere was true bliss. The staff were very friendly and brought us lots of turkish treats. The food was delicious and the breakfasts were my favorite. At this hotel you feel as if you are standing on the very edge of europe (well you actually are). If you are having trouble deciding on what Four Seasons hotel or any hotel in Istanbul I would highly recommend the Four Seasons Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay in”
Reviews.Author: ibrahim h
Reviews.Content: a good place to stay in and relax, you may ask for a sea view which might be better than the side view. all Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. close to some shoping area. good for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “A trip of a lifetime in a hotel of a lifetime...”
Reviews.Author: byrnes7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Istanbul, Turkey for a business/pleasure trip in September '11. Istanbul the city was beyond fabulous. I have travelled frequently in Europe and I have to say that this is the most interesting and exotic European city I have been to. One of the highlights of the trip was our stay at the magnificent Four Seasons Istanbul at the Bosphorus. Overlooking the Bosphorus strait, this prison turned hotel was an architectural jewel. The hotel had a regal feel to it and of course, the service and amenities were up to the usual Four Seasons standards. Our suite was fabulously outfitted with monochromatic (ie peaceful) decor which was difficult to leave every day. The neighborhood on the European side of Istanbul was charming and bustling-the hotel is tucked in between palaces and classic European manors. If you have the opportunity to stay at a hotel of this caliber, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: GeoffB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after FS at Sultanahmet. Staff were professional and courteous, and the hotel was of the standard expected of a FS. Staff in the lounge/bar were particularly helpful, and the hotel was really beyond crticism. We were lucky to be upgraded to a Bosphorus room, and this made the transfer worthwhile for us. However, the hotel does lack the charm of Sultanahmet, even in the Palace building, and certainly in the modern "wings" and were we forced to choose, we would certainly return there, and not here. The Bosphorus room rate is around $1700 per night, and nice room though it is, it doesn't justify that. Had we not had the upgrade to the Bosphorus view, I think we may have been disappointed to have moved.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property and OK for a Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: SeattleDowntown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here of one night and everything was very good; no specific complaints and it was Four Seasons quality except the service was not quite as warm and engaging as I'm used to at a Four Seasons. It was efficient, but not very personal. I stayed at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet on this same trip where the staff was fantastic with over the top personal service and of course an amazing location in the old city. If I had to recommend one over the other, it would be the Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and service”
Reviews.Author: AndPulli
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions. It is an excellent hotel - the location, right on the Bosphorus, is hard to beat. The restaurant is very good - breakfast on the terrace overlooking the water is a great way to start the day. If you happen to be there during ramadan, the evening meal is something to behold. The pool is idyllic and the fitness centre and spa are both first class. Service is always attentive without being over the top. It's difficult to identify any negatives (other than the price!).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carole B
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the day of our departure, everything was taken care of flawlessly. We would definitely return to the Four Seasons Bosphorus. We have recommended this hotel to a couple of friends already.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mathieu L
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, perfect room, good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Brunch at Four Seasons@Bosphorus in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: irza38
Reviews.Content: Great food, great services and great ambiance! The hotel is next door to the famour Dolmabahce Palace and one can also take a boat for a ride or cruise to the Asian side, to the Grand Bazaar in the Old City or just a leisure cruise on the Bosphorus, with or without dinner, all from the hotel's doorstep. The service is excellence and worth your stay there,especially in summer when the view of The Bosphorus is simply priceless !! Check out more on my Blog at http://1001-nights-in-istanbul.blogspot.com.

Reviews.Title: “Autumn in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: KK39
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for an autumn getaway from rainy Denmark. Weather was warm and sun was shining. I was travelling with my six year old daughter and we had a fantastic experience. The facilities (indoor/outdoor pool, large terrace and spacitious rooms) at the hotel make it a perfect place for the balance needed when travelling to cities with small kids. Staff was friendly and helpful as always at FS. Food was great. Minor points are that you need to select newspaper in paper each day. Review tyo hotel was answered by manager with update on changes to in room entertainment implemented in 2012. I would definitely choose this hotel over the FS sultahnamet. While traffic can be a hasle, taxis are cheap and the buzzing and hectic feeling of the city is part of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lov2travel888
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel for an entire week and were thrilled to be there everyday. The views of the Bosphorous are outstanding. The service at this hotel is outstanding-from the front desk to the concierge to housekeeping. We enjoyed the best brunch/dinner buffet on Christmas Day-it was the best buffet we have ever seen. Our room was comfortable, clean and quiet-a true respite after being in the chaos of Instanbul during the day. The indoor pool was fabulous and we took advantage of it most days. The private hammam is great. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it is worth every penny. If you are spending 4, 5 or more days in Istanbul, I recommend staying at the Four Seasons Sultanhamet for two nights to make it easier to see the sights in the old city, but I'd definitely stay here the other nights. The Bosphorous location is conveniently located for visiting the Palace Dolmabache, taking the ferry tours of the Bosphorous, traveling to the Asian side, going to restaurants and getting to Taskin Square. Love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: For our thirtieth anniversary we had decided to go to Istanbul and booked our accommodations through Amex Travel. By doing so, we were cheerfully upgraded to really special suites that were spacious and very enveloped in the cultural feel of the country. The Four Seasons has 2 locations in Istanbul, and we heard you can split your stay between the "old" and "new" city locations and we did just that. What spectacular locations and accommodations. The Four Seasons staff are truly professionals and were some of the nicest people we've met in Europe (we get around a bit). From the front desk, to the concierge to the doorman, everyone was super patient, courteous and genuinely helpful. I can't say what a difference the people can make.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: bernardvalerie_11
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay here. Best hotel I've stayed in for years. I wish all hotels were as nice, friendly, comfortable, etc as this one..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent relaxation - stunning views”
Reviews.Author: Matkatin
Reviews.Content: Spa and the pool of the hotel are absolutely fabulous, as indeed is the whole establishment itself. Everything is well-pointed, orderly, and just works - thanks to the great service. The restaurant was also top-notch, especially for desserts. Stayed here after some nights in Four Seasons Sultanahmet, which proved out to be a good combination to see the more of city and to be able to relax fully. Warmest thanks to all of the staff, and Mr. Yalin Akalan in particular for being the most gracious host. Room 1211 is indeed spectacular. Traveling with my father who had wished for several decades to enjoy the shores of Bosphorus in the grand old style so often forgotten in this modern world, this was truly an experience of a lifetime. I am looking to return with the next generation. In the mean time, I can recommend the property without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Choice location”
Reviews.Author: vanderhof
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on the Bosphorus with exellent views from the dining room and lobby. Garden view rooms are luxurious but no water view Views at night with the bridge lit are magical Very good dining room for breakfast and dinner with a range of styles and fairly good service One of the few places in Istanbul that can make an exellent Martini The extravagant orchid arrangements everywhere were wonderful Only drawback is the neighborhood has nothing to see or do-everything a 20 minute walk (or cab) away

Reviews.Title: “Superb, luxurious hotel with the most beautiful and large indoor pool I've ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: bill2newyork
Reviews.Content: This is a superb property with service that anticipates every need. It is nicely located right on the Bosphorus and away from the hubbub of the major tourist sites but close enough that they are an easy cab ride. The concierge staff is knowledgeable and listen to your needs and wishes, unlike some even in some luxury hotels. In short this is an extraordinary experience. We visited the Four Seasons Sultanabad twice for drinks, but we were SO very glad we chose to stay at the Four Seasons Bosphorus which is very spaciou and open and light, and the one in Sultanabad, while lovely, struck us as slightly claustraphobic.

Reviews.Title: “Again amazing -- couldn't be better”
Reviews.Author: Ana-Maria Z
Reviews.Content: We stayed again here and remain very impressed and delighted we did. This is a "big", new hotel that manages to do it right. The staff is excellent, the rooms (even though no Bosphorus view this time) spacious and excellent, and the facilities so good we actually used them! Do NOT miss swimming the the cistern-like pool and enjoy the view from almost every public room. Splurge, it's wonderful. (The only possible critique is that it is a tad removed from the action, but the taxis are plentiful and cheap, and being near the artery is a plus if you are going anywhere -- so technically, it's "central".)

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS THE BEST FOUR SEASONS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed S
Reviews.Content: Please I would like to thank each member of your perfect staff. Actually this is my best stay at any Four Seasons hotel. Thank you from my heart for making our stay super perfect and I will be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, beautiful views, but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: PBKucka
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Bosphorus is a tough hotel to rate. On the one hand, it is a spectacular hotel with amazing rooms, great service and unparalleled views. On the other hand, we had a couple issues with the hotel that were grievous, which we will explain. First, the high points. The hotel provided us (at cost) with a pick-up from and back to the Istanbul Airport. This service is superb â€“ the assistant was waiting for us when we got through customs holding a sign up with our name. They took our bags and loaded them up in the vehicle, which was conveniently parked right near the door of the airport. The vehicle was a very nice Mercedes and there were refreshments waiting for us, including chilled water. This was a private transfer, so the guide told us about Istanbul as we drove (the drive from the airport to the hotel can take up to an hour, depending on traffic). The private transfer is a great option, but it is very expensive. Honestly, we recommend just getting a taxi. The taxis are plentiful, easy to use and are a fraction of the cost of a private transfer. Once at the hotel, the porters whisked our luggage away to our suite and we were checked in quickly. We had a rooftop suite and, if you can afford it, we highly recommend it. The room was amazing. It was a studio suite, but very large. The main living room portion was equipped with a beautiful couch and chairs with a central coffee table that became our main area for spreading out maps and books and going over photos. The room included an espresso maker, beautifully designed closets, copious mirrors throughout the suite and many other amenities. The bathroom was a giant marble tiled cavern with a spectacular rain-head shower and large soaking tub. As with all Four Seasons properties the provided toiletries and bathroom amenities were above average. The bedroom area was equally impressive with a beautiful king sized bed. Throughout the suite, the art work, design and decorations were commensurate with a 5-star hotel and very well done. Perhaps the most spectacular part of the suite, though, was the rooftop patio. The patio is accessed through sliding glass doors from the living room and includes chaise lounge chairs and a large open area â€“ it is very private and is great for sunbathing in any state of undress or even hosting guests for drinks. But everything else is overshadowed by the incredible view of the Bosphorus from the patio. There are few vantage points that will give you equal views both up and down the straight. You can easily see the spectacular bridges to the North and the port to the South and everything in between. The sight will take your breath away during the day, but really comes alive at night when everything is lit up. The patio in the rooftop suite is worth staying at this hotel for at least a night. The hotel itself was equally very good. The breakfast (included in our suite price) was absolutely superb, which is a Four Seasonâ€™s forte. Most Four Seasons hotels are known for their restaurants almost as much as their suites, and this hotel did not disappoint. We ate one lunch and all our breakfasts in the hotel restaurant and were not disappointed. The concierge service was world class and provided us with excellent recommendations and was very helpful in making reservations, and changing or cancelling reservations as our plans changed. For example, we had scheduled a private cruise on one of the evenings and found ourselves across the city with no way to make it to the boat in time. We were at serious risk of completely missing our cruise and still having to pay for it. We called the hotel concierge and told him our issue and he called the cruise company for us and arranged to have the cruise cancelled at no charge to us (even though the boat had already departed to come pick us up). Unfortunately, we did have some complaints about the hotel. First, our common complaint with luxury hotels â€“ no free internet service. It fairly boggles the mind that when you are paying well over a $1000 a night for a hotel room, that they still want to nickel and dime you for internet access. Unacceptable in this day and age. The location of the hotel can be an issue for some activities. In order to get the spectacular views of the Bosphorus, the hotel is situated fairly far North along the strait. This means that almost nothing in Istanbul is within walking distance of the hotel and, as you will learn quickly, traffic is horrible. Every time we travelled down to the Sulhmanet side of the city (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, etc.) it took up to an hour to fight our way through traffic in a taxi. Eventually, we learned how to use the tram system and that was much quicker (but not quick). Also, the tram does not run all the way to the hotel, so you are forced to either walk the rest of the way from the last tram stop (a good 15 min walk) or try to find a taxi, which turned out to not be that easy in that area. We also chose to book several spa appointments at the hotel, and although the treatments were good, they were not worth money. We had the couples hammam, where one of our therapists ran out of the mud and only covered part of our body instead of all of it, and we felt rushed after completing our experience instead of being able to relax before we needed to leave. There are many amazing places to get a massage and a traditional and/or luxury hammam in Istanbul instead of wasting your money at the Four Seasons spa. Finally, our biggest complaint is another one that, for us, seems to be common in Four Seasons hotels â€“ they tried to overcharge us. Normally, I wouldnâ€™t make a big deal about a minor billing error, but this was far from a minor error. They tried to overcharge us by about $2000. When I went to check out of the hotel, I was running a bit late and almost left without checking the final bill, but I decided to get a copy with a zero balance, and I am glad I did. When I saw the bottom line price, I almost fainted â€“ it was way higher than it should have been. I pointed the price discrepancy out to the desk clerk and he, at first, balked and told me it was correct. Risking being late to the airport, I made him go through the charges line-by-line. The bottom line is that they had added charges for things we did not do/buy and overcharged us on the room costs by almost 50% in some cases. A manager came over and the bill was corrected, but this could have been much more difficult if I had left without checking the bill. Overall, this is a superb hotel. It is definitely a 5-star property, but the attempt to overcharge us on almost everything left a bad taste in our mouths. We recommend the hotel, but highly recommend you think about the location and definitely check your bill closely!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected thrill for a magic experience”
Reviews.Author: Murphles
Reviews.Content: We touristed Istanbul for a week and deliberately changed neighborhoods and style...glad we did. We loved BOTH the FS Old City and the Bosporus, though totally different in style. This hotel is big, modern and grand! Our perpective is colored by an upgrade to the Bosporus side which was a fabulous, magical view...simply breathtaking. I normally don't like hotels with shops and miles of corridors, but this felt different. The bar was cozy and with a perfectly light menu...the stores were interesting and well-chosen...and we even dined in for Republic Day with a festive turkish menu (staff was worried what people would think, but everyone seemed to like it)...and the pool is to die for. Quiet, conveniently located, special.

Reviews.Title: “ideal for istanbul with family”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: it has an outside pool, as well as indoors pool/spa. restaurant is kid friendly. food was so good we cancelled an outside restaurant romantic diner a deux so we could eat with the children! avoid rush hour for getting to old city - should take 20 mins , can take 1 hour 20 mins, quicker walking. standard "business class " four seasons stuff otherwise- but thats what we expected so no surprises positive or negative.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel I recommend very much to all visitors, at least if you can afford it, it is really worth it. Amazing location, amazing views, great services, smashing breakfast. A must go. Now one thing, I've noticed that they have the tendency to say "no" first if you request something ("another room", as of course, as a gay couple, they gave us the noisiest room, close to the road, or a "late check out", or anything you ask). But then, they call back and fulfill your needs. i wonder why not just do it before saying "No", since they will say yes at the end (LOL). Anyway, special thanks to the female concierges, who are extremely helpful, almost giving you the itinerary for the day, which was great, as one can get lost in the city or miss some amazing places. The gym, spa, hammam, sauna area is just amazing. Even the food in the bar (avoid the restaurant for lunch or dinner, too posh and food not as good as the bar) is great. I must say that we were quite sad to leave the hotel, since we had such a great time in Istanbul, thanks to the hotel staff as well. Congrats. I'm impressed (does not happen that often, especially in Europe); We'll go back there if we can...

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: rademakera
Reviews.Content: it's our home away from home. love it - central, clean, roomy, great breakfast, excellent service. And, WHAT A VIEW!

Reviews.Title: “An Unforgettable Experience”
Reviews.Author: LovesParis_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Four Seasons for 6 nights and we loved every moment. We had a room with a view of the Bosphous which was beautiful. The service and high standards lived up to every expectation that the Four Seasons brand name carries. The location is a little removed from the heart of the tourist action, but this is a good thing. It's a short walk to Ortakoy, which has some nice bars and restaurants and also to Besikitas which is also great. While I love to retire to the wonderful comfort of a hotel like this at the end of a busy day I also prefer to eat a little more "locally" and feel the city and culture of the place I am visiting. The Four Seasons made this easy to achieve - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fi H
Reviews.Content: A typical Four Seasons hotel with a great view. Service, spa , rooms, food everything was great, as it always in at Four Seasons hotel. The only thing we could not stand is the traffic, but that has nothing to do with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Elena123_11
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best hotels-extremly large rooms,the service is high level,spectacular breakfast outside as they have great terrace near the Bosphorus.The hotel has two big pools outside and one indoor pool where is the spa.The outdoor pools are very good,they serve you as compliment the,give you some fruits etc.The SPA is very good,hot jaccuzi inside,one large pool,separate (men/wome) hammam,sauna.If you want to have a walk around the hotel it's really well positionned-near some nice area full of bars,restaurants and cafes (I forgot the name,something with 'O' maybe?),walking distance by 10 min max. This hotel is really my favourite one of almost at least 4 Four Seasons I have experienced!

Reviews.Title: “FOUR SEASONS, my favourit hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: elisabeth h
Reviews.Content: I loved the stay in FOUR SEASONS BOSPHORUS ever so much, because I like especially the style of FOUR SEASONS as well as the staff, their manners und their professional doing. Thats why I prefer to stay in FOUR SEASONS on every spot in the world, where they are located.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi75
Reviews.Content: I am sure part of the wow factor here was the amazing upgrade we received to a One Bedroom Palace Bosphorus Suite (we booked with American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts). Having spent two nights at the Sultanahmet property we were transferred between the hotels in a BMW 7 series (complimentary) and then escorted straight to our room, with no check in formalities required. The room was spectacular â€“ approximately 80 sqm with really high ceilings. We could barely tear ourselves away from the view. The breakfasts were excellent â€“ huge selection and high quality. The staff were exceptionally friendly and professional and what a way to dine â€“ sitting out on the terrace overlooking the Bosphorus. We tried out the spa which was good, but not great. We also spent time by the pool and the Cabanas are excellent, and the pool staff very friendly â€“ we appreciated the glass cleaning service for our sunglasses and the iced towels, and novelty treats. We had a poolside lunch where one meal was not of an acceptable standard, however this was handled well by the staff. We got the hotel to organise a booking to Dolmabahce Palace which is about a 30 minute walk away. Make sure to get a reasonably early booking time as otherwise the queues can be horrendous. Do stay in the Palace Building and not the newer wings as it is has real character. We loved this hotel and struggled to rejoin our Silver Spirit cruise after such an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Beyond...”
Reviews.Author: SylviesMama
Reviews.Content: ! !! If you want a definitive hotel experience on the Bosphorus, stay here. Incredibly exquisitely beautiful. And if you want to give the most special dinner party in all of Istanbul, no small statement, give it here. The staff will be as excited as you are to welcome your guests and will pull out all the stops. Lovely, gracious, low key and hospitable in the extraordinary sense of the word, the FS Bosphorus is a real hotel for people of discriminating taste.

Reviews.Title: “The best City hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: designer16
Reviews.Content: i have been lucky enough to stay at many 5 stars, and have written a few Trip adviser reviews. This is the first time i have ever awarded 5 stars, as i was waiting for the perfect, flawless hotel experience and finally found it here. If you are consdiering coming, expect exemplary service, beautiful architecture, fantastic setting, luxurious bedrooms, great food. Negatives.. Itstanbul traffic is dire, so the taxi from the airport is a long slog. The lighting in the bar and the restaurant is a bit harsh, but that's a pretty minor issue, given the numerous attributes. can wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: skierlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed just 2 nights but it perfect. The room, the grounds, the restaurant, the bar were all top notch. The staff treated us like we were royalty. The bed was so comfortable and the room was like a mini apartment. Very clean. It was away from all of the noise of the Old City but close enough by taxi to enjoy and then leave. Istanbul is one of our favorite places in the world and everyone should go at least once in their life.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, in a most interesting and cultural city-when can I return?!!”
Reviews.Author: keentraveler30
Reviews.Content: I haven't gotten the pleasure of staying at this property, only visiting, eating, and using the spa, but could there be a more beautiful, incredible, gorgeous, and first rate property? I don't think so! Everything about it is perfection, including the grounds, the architecture, the spa, the restaurants, and the VIEWS! This is the icing on the cake-views of the Bosphorus, with the boats sailing by-there's nothing more beautiful or incredible!! I also received first rate service at the spa, although the woman who gave me my pedicure at the salon was less than enthusiastic. It deterred me from getting my hair done, but other than that-I received more than excellent service at the restaurants, and could there be a more impressive and gorgeous pool?? Such a pleasant surprise, as I wasn't expecting amazing pool life in Istanbul. I don't have anymore to say about this property except-when can I come back??

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: dgely
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at FS in August. We absolutely loved this hotel. The rooms, common areas, pool and restaurants were beautiful. We liked the location and being on the Bosphorus was stunning. We also enjoyed walking to dinner to Ortakoy for dinner every night. The FS has a fabulous buffet breakfast and the dinner was just as good. It was a magnificent view dining outside overlooking the Bosphorus. We would absolutely recommend staying here. It is the place to be in Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Dietrying
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better place to stay from the room to the facilities to the people at the Four Seasons, everything was perfect. One woman in Particular, Derya Perrault, at the concierge desk was one of the best, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: hannah187337
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much.The upgraded room we got was very comfortable and the staff was always kind and very helpful. We certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I thought I had experienced it all”
Reviews.Author: OorWullieSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice at this property in July 2011. I've stayed at many 5 Star hotels around the world however the Four Seasons beat them all hands down. Apart from the stunning setting on the banks of the Bosphorus, the service here is outstanding. I was so impressed with the staff's attention to your every need without having to ask. All staff spoke excellent English and not once did I find any who could not answer any question I asked. The hotel is immaculately presented and the smallest rooms are 45 square metres plus. One day, after housekeeping had made up our room, the young man returned and presented my wife with a range of expensive toileteries - retail size - as he had noticed whilst making up the room that she used that particular brand of fragrance. That's service for you! Breakfast is sensational with a wide and varied selection of excellent dishes. The hotel has a distinct air of professionalism, everything being under control, and every member of staff well aware of the role they play and the customer's experience being their primary focus. This is a clear sign of the quality of the management team they have in place. I would like to congratulate this team, and also all the staff who made our visits some of the most pleasurable experiences we have ever had. We look forward to returning in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in an amazing destination”
Reviews.Author: jane02
Reviews.Content: After an Oceania cruise from Barcelona to Istanbul, myhusband and two travelling partners spent four amazing nights at this fantastic hotel. It was a former palace and we felt like royalty! The staff were 100% helpful, friendly and always on hand. The rooms with their incredible view of the Bosphorus River were 1st class. I did not use the day spa but the pool itself was relaxing and the hair dressing slaon was also very good. We ate at the hotel restaurants and the breakfast which was included in our package was delicious with loads of variety. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing . It was a wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Chris W
Reviews.Content: 4 Aussie friends had a fantastic few days at the Four Seasons this was the finale to our Greek Islands & Turkey holiday. We could not fault a thing the staff especially were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “loved it !!! miss it!!!”
Reviews.Author: BND_2009
Reviews.Content: my husband and myself visited Istanbul 2009 and we stayed at the Four Seasons Bosphorus!!! All i can say is that its heavenly. The location on the banks of Bosphorus is breathtaking. the rooms are lovely and spacious. the food esp. the breakfast is amazing ( i still dream about it) but above all the service is A-class. the staff are super friendly and really take time out for that 'personal touch'. The suggested great palaces to eat and shop (the shopping is amazing) and were very prompt in getting us reservations in some of the best restaurants in town. We enjoy traveling and have been blessed to visit some beautiful palaces but Istanbul will always have a special place in my heart ... esp because of the impeccable hospitality extended by the team at Four Seasons Bosphorus. thank you... for making it so special Love to all at the Four Seasons Bosphorus .... truly hope to see you soon

Reviews.Title: “The Terrace!”
Reviews.Author: MWG_TX
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over a year ago and tried to get into the other Four Seasons but it was booked. This one is not near all the tourist stuff but there is some good stuff around it, shopping, etc. I was really disappointed in the building. They took an Ottoman palace and made it look like a medical office building anywhere. Very few of the rooms have views and you really pay for the tiniest sliver of view. And there is the usual overbearing Four Seasons service (like being in a swarm of gnats). But the terrace! Sitting on the terrace of this hotel is one of the wonders of the world. To the right is the outline of old Istanbul (like a dream), to the left is the bridge and it's lights, and in front is the Bosphorus and Asia and it seems that the entire world is passing before you. Little fishing boats, cruise ships, yachts, freighters, black Russian submarines(!). And every night someone around there had a wedding or party and did an elaborate fireworks show. I think it is the most marvelous, beautiful, and glamorous place I have ever experienced. We sat there every evening and marveled and on the couple of nights that we went somewhere else... nothing else compared. The terrace of the other Four Seasons was pretty amazing because it's practically inside Hagia Sofia (It's right up against it). But you don't get the show.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property - but not as perfect as expected”
Reviews.Author: ValVil
Reviews.Content: We came here from the other Four Seasons in Istanbul. As previous reviewers have stated, if you want to be in the middle of the tourist area, the other location is better. However, this location has fantastic views and is overall a superior property...one to be experienced. As great as it was, we had a couple of disappointments. We stayed in the main building and sound travelling between rooms was unacceptable. We could hear the people in next room come and go all night, have a small party, then snore the remainder of the night. Hallway noise was equally noticeable. The other minor issue we had was with the food. While the service was great, the food at the other Four Seasons was a bit better, and a little lower priced. And, last but not least, we were on an American Express reservation that provides an upgraded room if available. At the other Istanbul Four Seasons, we were upgraded. At this one, there was no mention of it, even though it seemed clear that the hotel was not full. We didn't ask for it either, but it would have been nice to at least acknowledge the status. On the other had, the spa is better at this hotel, with one of the best experiences we have had worldwide. We feel we made the right decision to experience both of the Istanbul Four Seasons hotels, and we recommend others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Four Seasons Quality, But With a Few Gripes”
Reviews.Author: Globetrekker63
Reviews.Content: Make no mistake about it: this is a beautiful property, with Four Seasons standards all the way in term of training of staff and service (Four Seasons is the best in the world for their training and staff). By-way-of uniqueness of property, this Four Seasons ranks up there with the Gresham in Budapest, the Four Seasons Mexico City and the Four Seasons in Sultanahmet Istanbul. The grounds are very nicely done, and the setting on (and views to) the Bosphorus are fantastic- in some ways better than the Ciragan Palace up the street (latter looking a bit worn). The interior design of the bar area is very nicely done, combining hints of Turkish design with a transitional contemporary aesthetic that is neither modern, nor traditional. The breakfast on the terrace can't be beat for the views, and the buffet is very extensive (sadly though, no where near presented as nicely as the Ciragan Palace). All this said, this property is not perfect - which it really should be given its spectacular setting. Here are my gripes: 1./ The rooms: while very comfortable and done to a high standard, they are sadly bland, which is tragic in a city where there is so much to draw from by-way-of design aesthetic and beautiful things. The interior designer failed miserably on the rooms- he/she should have taken a walk and borrowed inspiration from the antique shops in Cukurcuma to the modern aesthetic of the Turkish designers at Derin and Autobahn to the many beautiful fabrics, ceramics, prints and metal work to be found beyond the tourist tack in the Grand Bazaar- many elements of which could have been artfully and tastefully integrated into Four Season's restrained approach to interiors (Four Seasons, to be fair, is not a boutique hotel chain). 2./ The horrible lounge music played on the terrace and outdoor areas- basically elevator music versions of Sade and Jobim in every permutation and combination of english, spanish, french and portuguese (same phenomena in many high-end establishment located across Emerging Market countries), catering, no doubt, to the prevalent crowd that seemed to be staying at the hotel- i.e. a too-much-money-but-too-little-taste combination of arriviste Americans, Russians and Gulf-Middle-Easterners. Memo to hotel management: Turkey has a rich music tradition- take some local pride and weave that into the repertoire. 3./ The swimming pool: crying out to be an infiniti pool, given its spectacular setting. Its ridiculous for such a comparatively new facility that one can't even see the bosphorus when in the pool, due to the surrounding lounge chairs. What could they have been thinking. 4./ Staff: while the staff was very Four Seasons professional and trained all the way, the front desk and concierge staff were oddly cold and detached for a country with such warm people- seems to be a typical phenomena in places that suffer from too much of the wrong kind of tourism, combined with a local economy where there are increasingly wealthy people. That said, the staff at the Four Seasons Mexico City still seem to retain their warmth, so its unclear why that same selection of staff doesn't apply in Istanbul. 5./ Internet- at nearly USD $700 per night, I just can't understand why they can't come up with a tourist package that includes internet charges, instead of charging an incremental 20 euros per day, which is really tasteless. Net-net, I would stay here again. Its a great hotel with still more potential to the extent that management chooses to seize upon the opportunity to make some refinements.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous new hotel on the bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: tallulahsoq
Reviews.Content: we just got back from 5 glorious days in istanbul, never had i imagined how captivating the city was - sexy, sensual, historic and modern, all at the same time. we have stayed in many four seasons, but this one is truly outstanding. in terms of location, it cant be beat! kinda in between the more hip and happening ortakoy/bebek areas, and the old sultanamet town across the bridge, plus the taksim/nisantasi shopping areas, the best thing about it is that it is literally on the water. as we were there in summer, the cool and constant breeze from the bosphorus helped cool us down, as we sipped on mint ice tea by the pool or at the bar. the rooms needless to say are big, very comfortable, and they provide really exotic fruits on the daily fruit platter, not just the quintessential apples and oranges - in fact there was none of that, but really sweet purple plums, plump juicy peaches, fresh apricots, tiny midget apples, and a variety of different grapes. these are the little touches that make this 4 seasons stand out from the rest. the service staff from the recep to the concierge to pool attendants, are awesome, always quick and willing to serve. the only thing is that they dont serve complimentary ice water by the pool, given that it's 33 degrees in the afternoon, people cant keep ordering juices, they need water. they charge around 6 euros for a small bottle of local mineral water, which you could get for free if you just stop by the gym. there is a dock for water taxi if you are so inclined to take it rather than sit in traffic, though they cost much more it is still a convenient way to travel across town. when in istanbul, do not miss the cruise on the bosphorus!! its the best way to see istanbul as many places need to be appreciated from the water. there are historic summer places built by the sultans, luxury villas on the asian side, tons of fish restaurants along the coast and all the beautiful bridges. there are different companies offering different cruises, but the best bet is to walk to the besistas ferry terminal 5 mins walk from the hotel, and hop on a local ferry. they are clean, comfy and cheap!! it was around 4 euros per person for a 1 hour sunset cruise by this company called dentur. ( they dont call it that, but since we took the 7pm boat, it was our sunset cruise). we watched the sun setting over the bosphorus, the sky lighting up in a myriad of colors, and the twinkling lights shimmering in the distance, it was truly the BEST 4 euros ever spent!! anyway, the hotel recommended their own 500 euros sunset cruise on the seasons private boat which probably would be a super amazing experience, but we were glad to have taken the local route and it was commendable that this alternative was actually suggested by the concierge halil, who is awesome with making all the restaurant reservations too. all in all, highly recommended hotel, and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: momof3ponies
Reviews.Content: We loved the restaurant and pool. The hotel was the perfect ending to a long day of touring and summer heat. The service was amazing, as to be expected with any Four Seasons. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: clydethetraveller
Reviews.Content: I've travelled extensively to Istanbul on business and while some of the other luxury hotels have better views in many rooms (Kempinski, Ritz Carlton or Swisshotel), I keep coming back here for the usual Four Seasons standard of service (not to mention the excellent bathrooms and linens). The restaurant on the Bosphorus has outstanding views and very good food and the pool is very well-placed to afford excellent views if you have time to relax. The fitness facilities are also first-rate. Although some of the standard rooms can be dark as they face the walls, the upgraded rooms are well worth it for better light and views.

Reviews.Title: “Borderline Four Seasons quality”
Reviews.Author: William_N
Reviews.Content: Location: as it says on the tin, it's right on the Bosphorus, with gorgeous views from the breakfast terrace across to Asia and the Bosphorus Bridge in the background. If you're on holiday, then the location is arguably not as good as its reformed ex-criminal sibling (the converted prison at Four Seasons Sultanahmet, which is right in the thick of things and walking distance from many of the main attractions). Rooms: large Four Seasons quality rooms and bathrooms with L'Occitane amenities. However, ours was on the top floor, level with the main road that was a constant source of noise from the city's drivers, who are not at all averse to using the horn. Surely the Four Seasons can afford to double- or triple- glaze the windows of all the rooms close to the main road? Service: excellent - generally efficient, great memory and genuinely friendly. Helpful concierge. Surrounding area: it's a pretty gritty area just outside the hotel entrance, though if you're feeling adventurous it's a fifteen minute walk north up to the interesting streets and restaurants of Ortakoy, or ten minutes' walk south to buzzing pedestrianised side streets of Besiktas where one can find the most delicious "aci badem" biscuits at the Yedi Sekiz bakery (go to the eatingasia.com website for mouthwatering photos). Check-out experience: efficient; no real complaints apart from the niggling feeling that the cost of better soundproofing for the room windows would be about the same as a weeks' worth of room charges. NB: Istanbul traffic can be very heavy, so leave for the airport in plenty of time.

Reviews.Title: “The best and most luxourious hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: UAEexplorer
Reviews.Content: After a busy bustling day in the city, there is no better place to unwind and feel comfortable than with the usual 1st class service of the four seasons hotel. I just loved the bosphorous view and never missed a sunset without sitting at the outdoor garden having Turkish Tea and sweets. Standard room sizes are adequate so set your expectations accordingly. I appreciated the hint of Ottoman design fused together with the contemporary four seasons look and feel that you would expect. The concierge was most helpful recommending great restaurants with breathtaking views. Most importantly, do ask for advice on how and when to visit the many tourist attractions. Breakfast in the Fourseasons Bosphorous is a different experience altogether, I haven't seen such variety at any of the other fourseasons I've been to. So make sure to include it in your package! An important point, please do get a private driver, taxis in Istanbul can be an uncomfortable experience sometimes. No matter what you experiance in Istanbul it's always reassuring and comforting to know that your coming back to a place that you can count on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great views”
Reviews.Author: nikosstephanietasos
Reviews.Content: We really liked the location of the hotel and the views of the Bosporus. We enjoyed the pool and the area next to the water. The whole staff was very friendly, hospitable and helpful. The concierge was especially helpful beyond any other places we have stayed. The hotel i slocated in an area where old palaces are lined up one next to each other making for a nice long walk wiht many things to see. We plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: BelleSouthAfrica
Reviews.Content: Outstanding setting and hotel.what a treat.The pool was fabulous for our children as it waa very hot.The concierge is very well informed as well.Altogrther what an outstanding hotel

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location in the summer”
Reviews.Author: socalifoodie
Reviews.Content: This was out third stay at this hotel - this time we came for a wedding - and it just confirmed how much we love this location in the summer!!! The Bosphorous views and R&R by the pool after a day of sightseeing is the perfect end to (an always) busy Ä°stanbul day. The gym and private hammam option is a real plus, as well. The wedding dinner was very well orchestrated. While room service was consistent and always on time, you definitely would not come here for the restaurants - many better options for the same price close by. Having said that, my kids finally discovered the chicken kebab on the childrens menu and loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: judetf
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Four Seasons hotel, with the elegant decoration and the great service that all four seasons hotel have.What made the difference is the amazing view and the great spa. We definetly recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outsanding service and excellent SPA and relaxing areas”
Reviews.Author: mdamore
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 week from Jun 27 with my little family (baby of 10 month) and everything was just perfect- Service was at the level you expect from a 4 seasons. For information, my wife and myself come from the Hospitality industry. All the team was just incredible with my baby and hotel conditions are perfect. As usual standard room are bigger than all other hotel in same category and pool and SPA are just outsanding (I think the best SPA I did after 4 seasons Provence in terms of facilities). Recommendation: if you don't like AC, ask housekeeping not to put it everytime they clean the room. It's a good idea to be in Besiktas area since less crowded. Public transaportation is an issue but that the case in all the CITY. I advise good walker to take the taxi to go to PERA/TAKSIM and nigh life area (Beyolgu/Asmanimescit) and to come back on foot (45 -55 min).- 10 min taxi. A shame that wifi not included in the room price`. But even if standard room rate start at around 480 EUR, if service and hotel is essential for your vacations, the experience worth largely the price!!! As usual, once you know 4 seasons, I still do not understand how that could be compared to other 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “I won't be back”
Reviews.Author: leloir
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Isanbul is a big, bustling, noisy place. It has a spectacular view of the Bosphorous and a first rate indoor swimming pool and spa. But there is musack in the elevators, loud parties every night by the outdoor pool and a clientele that spends a lot of time talking in very llud voices on cellphones and smoking big fat cigars. The hotel is in a terrible location for visiting Istanbul's important sites. For that, there is probably no nicer hotel than the other Four SEasons in town, which is a treasure. The Four Seasons Bosphorous is probably best situated for business downtown. Rooms are small. Prices are high and unless you spring for the $2500 a night suites overlooking the Bozphorous you will probably be disappointed with the view. (Other reviewers have showed photographs of their rooms with supposed Booherous views.) Our room cost 620 euros per night and overlooked the hotel awning and car park. It was in the main, old palace section of the hotel so had wonderful nigh ceilings but the room itself was tiny. Two decent closets but no good place to set the suitcase. Servicd at the hotel is hit and miss. Some employees were attentive and helpful. Others were inept. There was complete chaos, for example, with our bags when we checked in. A reservation was made with the concierge for dinner in the hotel restaurant, Acqua. When we arrived at the restaurant, they had no record of our name. We eventually got a table. Wish we hadn't. The food at Acqua was by far the worst meal we had in Turkey. Embarrassing for a high end resort to have a kitchen turn out the slop we were served. The chef, we were told is Italian so we ordered risotto, which was sicky, leaden glop. The pasta was overcooked mush. The services at the spa were also a disappointment. The sauna and steam are great but the 45 minute 150 Euro hamman treatment was a waste of money. Ic business is oaying for this hotel, grest. But as a tourist in Istanbulm paying 20 euros per day for Internet is absurd.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and accomodating”
Reviews.Author: 1956dee
Reviews.Content: Hotel overall was wonderful. "Garden view" rooms a bit of a stretch in the discription - they overlook the bell hop stand and the front entrance. Rooms with Bosphorus view large, comfortable with wonderful views. Lounge inside and out, relaxing and beautiful. Hamman experience for couples not only a pampered experience, but sensual. Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but there could be a little more "turkish" feeling”
Reviews.Author: notogo
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, and Four Seasons allways makes sure children feel special. Breakfast and dinner were nice, but at dinner it would be nice to have some turkish options to chose from and not only italian. The rooms are normal size. The spa and fitness are very nice and large and well equiped. Nevertheless it would be really good, if hotels like this stop charging outrageously for wifi.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: BarbNY
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons in the Bosphorus is a Four Seasons resort all the way. The rooms were beautifully appointed. The breakfast buffet was delicious and plentiful with an incredible view looking out on the water. The pool is amazing but felt bad that we were sightseeing and didn't get to use it as much as we would have liked. Two misgivings. It's a little far from the center of town so leave yourself extra time because the traffic can be really bad. Secondly, beware when they have weddings and parties. Our room was above the event space and the music was incredilby loud. All in all, this was a beautiful space to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Generally excellent hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: floramalone
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a large group in May. The booking staff were very helpful. The journey from the airport is terrible through a huge tunnel, with the hotel on a terribly busy road (there was a loud crash from an accident just after I arrived). The hotel is not near the main attractions but is located right on the Bosphorus. I did not like my room decor at all - Four Seasons fans might like the grey and beige colour scheme - but I and others in my group found it oppressive and dark. WIth help from the staff, my window opened, which made it less claustrophobic. The room was extremely comfortable, however. The common parts are quite neutral but, over a 4 day stay, the whole feel of the place grew more attractive. Low key luxury with a modern take on Turkish themes in some of the public areas - some of it with a bit less character. The outside terrace and views are wonderful. The breakfast is outstanding - other meals much less memorable. The public areas of the hotel were immaculate. What really makes this hotel special are the wonderful staff. They are impeccablly trained and polite throughout the hotel (all Turks I met in Istanbul were incredibly polite and helpful) . Nothing was too much trouble. From the concierges to the night room service staff, everyone was really oustanding. I was sick one night and was incredibly nicely looked after. Really outstanding service made it an incredibly pleasant environment to be in. I just wish the rooms were a bit more cheerful! For the views and the quality of service I would return and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Potty41
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel made to make you feel special. The grounds aren't extensive but have sitting areas and outside heated pool. Rooms are spacious with very big bathroom with walk in shower and bath. Towels and robes are fresh and new. Hotel is clean and spotless and staff really helpful. The only downside is this hotel is not close to any of the major attractions and nearest bars are a 15-20 minute walk away. Food is also expensive here.

Reviews.Title: “Once again the Four Seasons is perfect”
Reviews.Author: intrepidgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at this hotel, and again the Four Seasons achieved perfection. Great rooms and bathrooms, flawless service and beautiful communal spaces. The flowers at the Four Seasons are always breathtaking. Expect the drinks and dinner to be very pricey, but you're paying for the superb service and the beautiful views. Spa and indoor pool is wonderful, and of course the outdoor pool is the key selling point of this particular Four Seasons. Dinner was very romantic.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: N0hype
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at this hotel for the second time (each stay about 1 week) and once again had a great experience. The hotel is beautifully built. Guest rooms are very comfortable and quiet by Istanbul standards (you will still hear the early morning calls to prayers, so bring ear plugs). The decor of the public areas is classic and will likely age well, so this should be a great place for years to come. The highlights of the hotel are the terraces and the pool directly on the Bosphorus as well as the great gym, spa, and indoor pool. All of this makes it an oasis when visiting this busy city. The breakfast buffet was very good. We only had dinner in the hotel a couple of times, which was fine but unremarkable.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and special”
Reviews.Author: jeffny1972
Reviews.Content: That was a great hotel with excellent service,fantastic breakfats on the terrace overlooking the Bosphorus is amazing.The place makes you feel realy special in Ä°stanbul. That was one of the best hotel experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Kosmic48
Reviews.Content: Four Season's means nice location,nice building and fantastic friendly service.Food is decent.Breakfast is great! View is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rita_vine
Reviews.Content: We loved the feel and look of this beautiful hotel. The location was incredible. The food was very tasty. The price was a bit too high but it was well worth it. Istanbul is really a beautiful city. The hotel was near a university and busy location (Besiktas). This is probably the best Fours Seasons we have seen to date.

Reviews.Title: “great Easter in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: velocipator
Reviews.Content: Stayed for Easter Holidays with wife. The hotel was full so promised upgrade was skipped. Good room cleaning (incl free shoes polishing), good service at aqua restaraunt (a bit different at lobby's outdoor tables), great view on Bosfor. Weak sides: food is not as good as expected (better at 2-minute walk Kempinsky), no free internet, no cofee/teapots in rooms, carpet in room looked greasy (no other blames for the room), harsh road traffic to and out of the hotel. Would definitely stay again since at this price in Istambul is really difficult to have smth better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting, genuinely excellent service”
Reviews.Author: hungryperson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons Bosphorus this week for a business trip. The service was truly excellent. For example, I was shown to my room (actually I was upgraded to a gorgeous one-bedroom Bosphorus suite, Room 2301) by one of the staff. I told him I was feeling tired after a long flight so he made every effort to keep the formalities short and efficient. This is stark contrast to the 30-minute ordeal I endured at the Raffles earlier this week when I checked in. All the paperwork was done in my room, a shirt was taken to to be pressed, a car booked to go back to the airport and it all took about five minutes. Other examples of genuine service: I arrived early for a spa appointment and so I had a swim and a visit to the sauna. The attendant had said that he would come and get me when my treatment was going to start so I didn't have to take a watch or worry about the time - just relax. Afterwards, in the lounge I had some Turkish tea and the waiter saw that I ate the two cookies very quickly so he brought me four more, figuring rightly that I was very hungry. Everybody seemed genuinely friendly and, more important, actually paid attention to what I was doing and what I needed in the moment. The suite was awesome. Big comfortable bed, luxurious toiletries and nice touches like flowers and fruit. The bay windows had Ottomans in them so I could sit and watch the boats go by outside and stare at the Topkapi palace and mosques on the Golden Horn in the distance. It was one of the genuinely most Romantic and charming views from any hotel I have ever stayed in. The buffet breakfast was epic. Probably the best hotel breakfast I've had. Lots of choices and generous portions. They waiter brought me English breakfast tea and I mentioned that I had had Turkish tea the day before and suddenly a cup of that appeared too. Also, lovely omelette included in the buffet price. There are two Four Seaons hotels in Istanbul and this one is a little distance from the historic sites but it is in a lovely spot on the edge of the water. (The other is a converted prison, apparently!) For my business, it was actually very convenient - about ten minutes from the business district I was visiting. It's about 45-60 minutes from the airport, however, and hotel limo transfers are quite expensive as a result, although the 750il they sent was very comfortable and quiet and worth the money if you want a painless trip as taxis are a little cramped in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiriamPercia
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with wonderful views of the Bosphorus. Great Breakfast, fitness center and spa and lovely flowers all around the hotel. Rooms could be a little bit biggers. value stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service second to none...”
Reviews.Author: nathan_black
Reviews.Content: Obviously not the cheapest place around, but you do get a sense of luxury particularly with the service. I've yet to come across a hotel quite so helpful to provide all your needs. Staff were very attentive and often anticipated many of our needs, which was good, particularly as we were staying there for business. For example, I'd rushed to check in and get changed for a meeting. I'd taken out my travel iron but not used it. The turn-down service that evening obviously noticed this and when I returned I found an ironing board helpfully set up, ready for me to use! Bedrooms and bathrooms were nice although not as well appointed as I would have expected. Good toiletries, etc but I have found cheaper hotels with more 'wow' factor in the rooms. Having said that the Four Seasons feel really shines throughout the rest of the hotel. With an amazing outdoor area that is perfect for bosphorising (What Turks call the deep contemplation of the Bosphorus) and an outdoor pool, this is where all the luxury appears to be. The spa area (although downstairs) is wonderful with a well equipped gym and separate male and female spa facilities (including steam room, hammam, and sauna) Overall a very pleasant stay considering I was working the whole time!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel exactly what you would expect from a 5*”
Reviews.Author: lellaouafa
Reviews.Content: only point that i would make is that if it had been on the old city side of the bosphorus it would have been perfect.. a taxi in rush hour could take you that . the Aqua resturant was excellant for breakfast a great buffett listern out for the specials they are having,Aattention to the children was great as they felt part of the experiance and involved friendly staff we ate there once in the evening and loved it great food fantasticaly presented and good value Very Romantic for us as we had a babysitter and the baby radio worked so we could still relax. the spa was great my wife had a couple of treatments (hot stone and a relaxation massage) while i had the children in the pool and everybody loved it fantastic gym facilities. the room was excellant and the nice touch for the childs bed with a differant character cover everyday was a nice touch. i would recomend the visiting the rug shop in the basement ! the trams are easy and from Kabatas its a less than 10 minute journey the kabatas terminal is about a 15minute walk with children pass the Dabanache palace we preferd to use this as it was really easy and the stops are right by all the places to visit we even used the tube which was even easier and stops you getting taken advantage of by the taxis even with a meter and and after being advised about the approximate cost. just around the corner in the port we found a bunch of modern resturants the BeerPort being a lively place food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious experience, "room" for improvement”
Reviews.Author: SenoritaL
Reviews.Content: (1) Service: Second to none, best in business. All staff are very professional, courteous, and helpful. They always greeted us by name, and are very responsive to our requests and always do their best to satisfy our needs. From the moment we arrived at the hotel, to the moment we left, we felt truly welcome and being looked after. (2) Location: While it's not located in the centre of action, the hotel provides a refreshing escape from the hustle and bustle of Istanbul. In fact, it's not too far away from the city centre either. Buses run from the Kabatas tram stop to Besiktas, and from there the hotel is just 5 mins walk away. So everything is nicely connected. Taxi to Taksim takes about 15 mins but can greatly depend on traffic condition. A walk in the hotel's garden by the Bosphorus and watching the ferries crossing is such an invigorating and revitalizing experience! Here, we watched the New Year's Eve fireworks shoot out from every corner of Istanbul - simply amazing! (3) Room: This is the only area that needs improvement. The furnishings in room appear to be a bit outdated and somehow discount the luxurious feeling exuded by other parts of the hotel. While we find the room elegant and classy, it's not sophisticated nor upmarket. Being a Four Seasons hotel, we would expect the room (especially the bathroom) to be more refined, with more exquisite interior design. The bathroom has separate bath and shower, but again, the fixtures are basic and lack of a luxurious feeling. There is a mini bar, but no tea/coffee making facilities. Having said that, the bed is soft and comfortable, and room is immaculate. We must have been given a partial ocean view room as we could see the Bosphorus and beautiful water feature in the garden. Rooms that face the hotel entrance and main road could be quite noisy. (4) Spa: Divine! Separate areas for men and women, each has a changing area/locker, sauna, steam room, showers, and a relaxation room. The indoor heated pool and whirl pool are simply magnificent. Cold towels and bottled water are provided throughout the spa centre, and the staff are incredibly friendly and hard-working - used towels are almost always taken away immediately! The whole area is very neat and well-maintained. Spa treatments are also excellent albeit expensive, and I highly recommend the traditional Turkish Hamam. For ladies, I would recommend female therapists. (5) Concierge: Incredibly knowledgeable and helpful. They helped us book several restaurants long before we arrived the hotel. No question is ever too much, and they all seem to be very well connected with local business. Super efficient and pleasant as well! (6) Others: The hotel has a business centre where guests can access the internet. Wireless internet available from room, but not free. Obviously, the hotel has its own contracted taxi drivers, so guests are ensured that the taxi drivers understand English and that they are charged by the meter.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a wonderful setting.”
Reviews.Author: mw104
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a long weekend break. We have been to Istanbul before and have always stayed in the Sultanahmet so this time we decided to stay at the FS on the Bosphorus on the recommendation of friends. We booked through our Virtuoso agent and that gave us an instant upgrade to river facing room in the main building and include breakfast. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous - the main rooms are fabulously decorated with just the right amount of modern and traditional. Our room and bathroom were gorgeous - I want some of their blue light fittings for my home. The bed was extremely comfortable. The outside terrace reminds me of the terrace at the Oriental in Bangkok another one of my favourite hotels. I just loved sitting out there looking across to Asia and watching the activity on the river. In the evening if it gets a bit chilly - they bring around pashminas to keep the chill off. The breakfast was delicious as was the food in Aqua. We only stayed 3 nights which wasn't long enough - unfortunately it is quite expensive but I still don't think I'll be able to stay anywhere else when we go to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: thetravellerTR
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel in Istanbul. If you're looking for 5-star luxury, it should be definetely be your choice. If you want a historical atmosphere, you should stay at the old Four Seasons in Sultanahmet but this new one, with it's location and breathtaking bosphorous view is I think much better. The prices are very high, although if you're looking for quality and luxury, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: All the raving reviews about this hotel are true, and there is not much to add. Fantastic location, great service and lovely rooms. The hotel facilities are all very good.
