Breakfast bufeet in Aqua had everything you could ask for and more. Some minor flaws for the VERY picky traveler: - 9 USD dollar for a regular black coffee to go in the cafe - unbelivably, but true. - the beds are on short side. I am not a tall person, but my feet still fell outside the scope of the bed. - traffic noise is an issue if you get a room close to the the road in the South and North wing. - pool area nice, but not great. Feels a bit crowded if more than 4-5 people are in it.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning setting and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Glab73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is magnificently positioned over looking the Bosphorus. The staff are attentive without being fawning. The expanse of outdoor space on the waterfront is stunning. The city centre & historic sites are easily accessible by taxi. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful luxury”
Reviews.Author: Jobo27
Reviews.Content: We are recently back from a fantastic trip around Turkey. The Four Seasons lived up to its reputation for great service and wonderful luxury. This hotel was our bit of luxury after travelling on public buses and staying in 3 star hotels on our trip arpund Troy, Pergamum, Ephasus, Pamukkale, Konya, and Cappadocia. Everything was great at the Four Seasons and we couldnt fault it, particularly the buffet breakfast. A must here is to have a drink over looking the Bosphorus in the evening as there arent many places in Istanbul with this superb view (I would also recommend a boat trip up the Bosphorus to the Black Sea). The room was beautiful and large and the bathroom was a great bit of luxury especially the bath!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nobrepaula
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the other reviewers, the Four Season at the Bosphorus it's on the top of others 5 stars hotels. It was by far the best 5 star hotel we stayed during our trip. The location is great, you have a beautiful view of the Bosphorus, the staff is super helpful and the bedrooms are excellent. I felt I was staying at my home, but a much better one : ] Their breakfast it's what made me write this review, because was really something else. And I have to say I am celiac, so they had a special bread for me every morning specially made. If you can afford it, you should go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate standards as always”
Reviews.Author: capevas
Reviews.Content: After experiencing the superb George V in Paris, and now the even better Bosphorus, Istanbul establishment I suspect the Four Seasons hotels occupies the (very) top of the 5 star category. Staying there was more memorable than Ritz, Plaza, Lanesborough etc and even put the Burj al Arab to shame for service. I booked a deluxe room and was upgraded to a junior suite going for more than double the price. The decor was very comfortable, but not elaborately luxurious, housed in the annexe wings which unfortunately have a slightly declasse feel compared to the main palace building and afford you narrow angled views to the Bosphorus - this is intentionally a hotel where you must pay top dollar for really good views. But that's where the disappointment ended. The expansive sweeping terrace is great, even if you don't use the open air pool. The spa is comprehensive, and has the biggest indoor hotel pool I've ever seen. The food is also worth coming for (unfortunately priced in euros), especially as so many Istanbul restaurants are not of the highest quality themselves. But their biggest selling point is the famous staff courtesy, who remember your name and greet you anywhere they see you. The whole package is better than the Sultanahmet branch. It is the best hotel in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Palatial Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Redraisinz
Reviews.Content: After our stay for 4 nights at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet, we moved to their Bosphorus property for an additional 3 nights in the wonderful city of Istanbul. The weather was glorious. We enjoyed this side of the city much more than the historical side, because the property faces the water and this is the side where the locals are. The Bosphorus is simply wonderful and gorgeous. The scale is monumental, and the water serves all sorts of commercial activities. It is alive and full of energy. This hotel property takes full advantage of its location. The rooms are open, modern, and bright. The automated black-out screen (yes, operated with a switch) is a cool feature at both properties. Service is, as usual, top class. Love the breakfast buffet. Charming bay window offered a generous glimpse of the Bosphorus. The large plaza facing the water also offers a rare treat for Istanbul: smooth and level marble flooring! (Istanbul street paving is nothing but one giant tripping hazard). The ferry stations nearby (all within walking distance) provides easy access to the Bosphorus and the Asian side. A 15-minute walk northward took us to Ortakoy, a charming little port area favored by the locals and tourists alike. Dolmabahce Palace is a 15-minute walk southward. Taksim Square and Istanbul Modern are close by via taxi. There is a splendid fitness center equipped with state-of-the-art exercise equipment and includes a pilates studio complete with reformer and cadillac machine. The indoor mosiac pool is sublime with its underwater music system. The spa is huge and elegant. The husband enjoyed his hamman treatment, and I enjoyed my massage by a nice Balinese lady named "Su" (water in Turkish). On the downside, both Four Seasons property boast large televisions but the image and audio quality is nasty by US standards (HD TV anyone?). The main building is a former private palace that has been converted nicely. However, the annex buildings, although modern and plush on the inside, are not very attractive on the exterior. In fact I would venture to say the two white and brown annex buildings constitute a bit of an eye sore, especially compared to how attractive the rest of the place is. The large bed in our room (#3304) has sagged on both sides enough for me to notice during sleep. The circulation of the place is a bit awkard since the annex buildings are only connected on the ground floor. Especially if you are staying in the north annex building, and have to return to your room after using the Spa which is located in the basement of the south annex building. The husband, after his great hamman treatment, had to parade through the main lobby with a big towel rolled over his head (like a sultan!), and his robe and slippers. We asked for the hotel to arrange for an encore 4-hour private tour from Seda (who was our trusted guide a few days back and had galantly lead us on an 8-hour private tour when we were at the Sultanahmet side). Once again, Seda saved us a bunch of time because she knows where to go and essentially helped us free up another whole day. She is fun and easy going. Seda is more than a guide, she has become a good friend to us. Hooray! See my separate review of the Four Seasons Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a total of 5 nights (with a break in between to go to Cappadocia) and enjoyed my stay. Service is flawless and top notch. The fitness gym is expansive with a personal trainer on hand. The spa and the hamman is decadent. Every staff member is there to help.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick757
Reviews.Content: nice clean and comfortable rooms. great location super spa and swimming pool; good restaurant;

Reviews.Title: “An enclave of comfort and quality”
Reviews.Author: DaneP
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Four Seasons Istanbul at the Bosphorus. I was blown away by every aspect of FS Bosphorus. Details below. Arrival: A phalanx of doormen and greeters greeted us by name and ushered us quickly into the hotel. Turndown service and housekeeping touches: Bottles of water, accompanied by drinking glasses covered with protective caps for cleanliness. Plate of small desserts each night. Housekeeping touches: Tasteful bookmarks stamped with the Golden Horn motif, inserted in the novels we were reading. Fruit basked refilled daily. Toiletries: Full-size Aqua di Parma. Restaurants: At Aqua, the servers and maitre dâ€™ went out of their way to ensure that our meals were enjoyable, tailoring them to our preferences, introducing us to local specialties when they sensed our interest, and warmly greeting us by name each morning when we arrived for breakfast, which included an incredibly lavish buffet and made-to-order items. Service and quality of food for dinner and lunch was consistently high. Spa and Fitness Center: Spacious, high-ceilinged fitness centerâ€”one of the largest Iâ€™ve ever seen in a resort or hotel. The spa itself is a superb space, with menâ€™s and womenâ€™s areas on each side of a columned, tiled indoor pool. In each of the gendered areas, the dÃ©cor is subtly evocative of Turkish design, with lamps and candelabra creating a sense of place. Each side contains a waiting area, relaxation area, steam room, and sauna. Public Areas--Interior: Exquisite. As usual with FS, tremendous floral displays in the public areas, and subtle design elements that speak of Istanbul without ever devolving into kitschâ€”a fireplace in the lounge that echoes the shape of the fireplaces in the Topkapi harem, objet dâ€™art of museum quality, Turkish carpets, etc. Public Areasâ€”Exterior: In a subtle reference to the marble terracing that abounds at Topkapi, FS has used the same white-and-gray marble to create a really superb outdoor space, with a fountain, benches, and red gardenias galore. To the left of the hotel is the outdoor dining areaâ€”Aqua restaurant and an outdoor lounge for more casual orders throughout the day. To the right is the pool. But straight in back of the hotel simply and perfectly an open terrace of marble, centered upon a fountain, so that the views from the hotel to the Bosphorus are unmarred. The pool area is very smartâ€”and the cabanas are free, first-come, first served. Turkish-themed music is piped underwater. Guest Rooms: Iâ€™d steer clear of any of the rooms in the annexes, which lack the high ceilings of the palace building. See below for a glimpse of the unattractive annex buildingsâ€”which you donâ€™t see on the website. I stayed in Palace Garden room--because I knew I wanted to be in the historic main building with its high-ceilinged rooms. My mistake was not to have splurged for a Bosphorus view in the palace building. Iâ€™d assumed that I wouldnâ€™t spend enough time in my room to pay the premium for that view, but each time I walked by one of those rooms with the door propped open by housekeeping, the view out to the Bosphorus really did take my breath away. I have to say: I think itâ€™s worth it. But so you can judge for yourself, Iâ€™ve posted the views from the rooms facing the front of the hotel, overlooking the entrance. Not an eyesore, but certainly not the Bosphorus, either. Regardless of view, I loved the room itself in the main buildingâ€”very high ceilings, painted. Contemporary furnishings, in soothing taupe and pale blue. Arched ceiling in the bathroom. Rather than the typical Four Seasons pillows and bedding (white with a colored rectangular border), the bedding here, equally comfortable, was off-white with a subtle pattern. Service: Superb, across the board. Everyone knew our names; the concierge team delivered daily reminders, on evocative cards designed to replicate famous Ottoman tiles, of our reservations; noting from her passport that my girlfriendâ€™s birthday has occurred in the past week, they delivered a surprise chocolate dessert to our room within an hour of our arrival. Summary: I was lured back to Istanbul entirely because of the praise that many of you and others have heaped upon this hotel/resort, and I must say that every bit of that praise was deservedâ€”staying here was worth the cross-Atlantic trip all by itself, even if Iâ€™d never left the hotel to re-acquaint myself with Istanbulâ€™s charms (including, after 17 years, the removal of the scaffolding from the central dome in Hagia Sophia). It was genuinely difficult to leave, so comfortable, beautiful, and generous is the spirit that pervades the entire place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: whitey_10
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. I travelled with my 15 and 8 year old daughters. We absolutely loved the hotel. It is modern chic within an old castle type of style. The service was impecable from all the staff members. Best treatment i have had from staff of a hotel, and i have visited hundreds of hotels from all classes within my life time. This has got to be my number one favorite from all that i have seen with regards to the professinalism, facilities, treatment, rooms and hotel luxury. Even Burj AlArab in Dubai didnt treat us as professional as this hotel did. I slaute all staff memebrs who have made our trip a memorable and delightful one. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone that wants luxury and doesnt mind spending a little extra money for it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply stunning”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryLoverLondon
Reviews.Content: Stunning location with beautiful common parts, pool, spa etc. Close enough to city sites but far enough for some peace and quiet. Only criticism would be the complete lack of any view from our room (1st floor in left hand new building). Go for main building or higher floors in new blocks. Expensive but worth it. Wifi was pricey and did not work very well, but they credited this when I complained.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Pampering, Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyWanderlust
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through the American Express platinum hotel program and couldn't have been happier. Having been to Istanbul previously, we wanted a place to relax for a day before embarking on a cruise. Upon arriving at the hotel at 11 a.m., our room wasn't ready so they immediately upgraded us to a junior suite overlooking the Bosphorus that not only looked beautiful, but had all the necessary appointments one would want. We put on our bathing suits and headed to the pool that was beautiful with a gentle wind cooling us off. The attendants couldn't do enough for us including their serving different frozen non-alcoholic fruit drinks every hour in a different flavor. There was a casual restaurant adjoining the pool area that was quite expensive but hit the spot for a light bite during the early afternoon. The concierge was wonderful having made several bookings from at home for us. A driver was waiting at the airport for us and promptly took over our luggage upon our identifying ourselves. A dinner reservation was made for us at the Sunset Grill, a restaurant I would highly recommend that overlooks the city with breathtaking views and wonderful food. I was told about this restaurant from an expat, and it didn't disappoint. This upscale establishment served many affluent locals, as well as a well-dressed international crowd. It was "country club casual" in attire and served a wonderful array of food selections including sushi. I ordered a fabulous grilled fish and my husband a seafood combination plate that were wonderful. We started with different appetizers and were mesmerized as we sipped our drinks while watching a nearby bridge turn colors every few minutes. The restaurant has it's own website where you can make reservations on line, but I had the concierge make the reservation for us several weeks in advance. The host noted to give us a v.i.p. table as requested by the Four Seasons. It was delightful. Also a reservation was made in advance for our visit to the Dolmabahce Palace the following morning. We hadn't gone their on our last stay, and it was very close to the hotel. It was an opulent building that was worth the visit and perfect to keep us occupied after a delicious breakfast served outside overlooking the water at the hotel. This was included in our American Express package along with a late check out. We returned to the hotel after a great tour of the palace that does require reservations for the English speaking tour and had time for a quick dip in the pool, before heading to the pier for our cruise which was nearby the hotel as well. This was a perfect start to a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, typical Four Seasons Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: matchenyankees
Reviews.Content: I'd have to say, this four seasons hotel is like no other. Great service, rooms, facilities and staff. The breakfast's are amazing, especially the pastry. The managers at the breakfast are really nice, you can ask them for special egg dishes, despite they are not included in the buffet. Only thing about this hotel is the location. It is not as good as the other Four Seasons in town, i would recommend you to get a car or else traffic maybe troublesome. In general, great hotel. I would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Rated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stub0612
Reviews.Content: This is a most for those who want style, class and comfort. Just make sure that you get a room overlooing the Bosphorus, it costs a little more but worth it. The beds were so comfortable and an ideal location and I have to say one of the best pools and pool areas to match any city hotel in the world... I will be returning

Reviews.Title: “Breathtakingly Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gfbarch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so beautiful it will take your breath away. The veranda and gardens overlooking the Bosphorus is like no other. It is as though some sultan has invited you to his person palace. From the marble floors to the impeccible food (the head chef is Italian) it is a jewel. My only recommendation is to request a room away from the main street and more toward the back of the hotel which overlooks the river. The street noise in early evening is noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “We did the Four Seasons; both of them in Istanbul JUST RIGHT”
Reviews.Author: vatripgirl
Reviews.Content: currently here right now at the Four Seasons at the bosphorus and we also stayed at the sultanahment hotel during our 6 night stay in Istanbul the first few days were heavy in sightseeing, so the sultanahment hotel was perfect since we were out of the hotel alot. The sultanahment hotel very superb, but the bosphorus property isout of this world. Our time now here at the Bosphorus is leisurely enjoying the water, the outstanding pool, the best spa ever been in ( and been in spas all over the world). Our Palace Garden Room is huge, bathroom fit for a sultan and the beds are sooooo comfortable. Fab breakfast buffet. Order mint lemonades while you are at the pool, yummo! All in all the usual professional and flawless FS service. I've stayed in other wonderful FS, but the Bosphorus might be my favortie

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel, stunning views, very special place to visit.”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Diva-KD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of May/ beginning of June 2010, for our first trip to Istanbul. We stayed in a Garden View Room, which was a bit disappointing compared to the views of the Bosphorus, but we didn't want to pay any more than we already were. The room itself however was fabulous, especially so with a window seat. The hotel sprawled right along the Bosphorus, so it felt amazing to sit and soak up the atmosphere of the passing boats and the sounds from all around. It's a magical place and we loved it. The weather was mostly good when we were there (with the exception of one or two rainy days) and we enjoyed breakfast at the outside restaurant. The service was seriously lacking at breakfast, with lots of inconsistencies. In fact, I felt like just a number: like they herded you to your seat and wanted to get rid of you ASAP, sometimes not offering coffee refils and giving you the cheque quite promptly. We like to take our time over breakfast, and we like to feel like special guests (especially for the money we paid) but it didn't happen. Our first day at breakfast we were told "Welcome back"! Well it is a busy hotel. The breakfast buffet itself was vast with lots of lovely foods to choose from. The service elsewhere in the hotel was excellent, but also with inconsistencies. Our first day at the pool, we were automatically given iced water, but the other days we went back to the pool this didn't happen. Some days the staff handed out iced drinks or fruit, but other days nothing. But the pool staff were very friendly and didn't seem to mind my pink rubber ring! The food at the poolside restaurant was excellent - for lunch we had margaritas and quesadillas (on two different days) and this was fantastic. We also came here for dinner and tried different meze foods with turkish bread, and my partner had the chicken shish, all excellent and with excellent and friendly service. The location of the hotel is both good and bad. On one hand, it is well placed a bit out of the city, with an excellent position on the Bosphorus quite near the Bosphorus Bridge. We were able to walk along to Ortakoy where there are a few cafes, restaurants and the Ortakoy Mosque. However, transport into the city centre wasn't quite as convenient. We had to walk quite far to a tram stop (Kabatas) to take us into Taksim Square. We took the commuter boat back as far as Besiktas and still had a bit of walking to do to get back to the hotel. But it's a small sacrafice to stay at such a grand hotel with a massive swimming pool, loads of space and amazing views. We had a fantastic holiday, with just the right mix of relaxation and sight-seeing. We would definitely return to this hotel. We saw Dame Shirley Bassey in the hotel bar on our last night! ((There was 1 wedding taking place during our stay, but it was raining so had to be moved indoors. It did not disrupt our stay in any way and we did not hear any noise whatsoever from our room.))

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Service”
Reviews.Author: London93
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel at least half a dozen times for work and look forward to my stay every time. Four Seasons are my favorite hotels and the reason is impeccable service. I never have to carry my suitcase, ask for another drink or explain any problem to staff. The food here is top notch and when I've had the extra time for a drink on the terrace or a spa treatment it's been absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “They've SOLD OUT--NOTHING BUT WEDDINGS EVERY NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: dooijp
Reviews.Content: First, day 1, despite arriving after check in, room was not ready. 2nd Day 1 wedding until midnight at mind-blasting decibels. No food allowed at the pool chairs. Day 2: they ask me when i plan to check out--as if they cared about when I wanted to check in. Wedding # 2--EVEN LOUDER. not only that they were testing equipment all day from 2 pm. So if you like lounging at the pool...NOPE! TEST, TEST , TEST every few minutes. I tried to move to go to next door to the Ciragan Palace and recommend everyone do the same. The hotel must be losing money as they are do nothing but late night disco parties. outdoors and Metallica decibel levels.. That said, the hammam treatment was well worth doing. I'm not some bitter tourist who can't afford FS--i've stayed at FS, Aman, and One and Only worldwide. This place although beautiful is no longer working. Try next door

Reviews.Title: “5 star Turkish Bath”
Reviews.Author: macamuy
Reviews.Content: I have visited The Four Seasons at Bosphoros and decided to join a Turkish Bath with my husband at the incredible spa. It was amazing, pure luxury, relaxing, pleasant moment. After the massage session that was made with only us in the same room, we went to the sauna (per gender) and then joined together the pool, which was fantastic. We could hear music when diving and relax under the small water fall fountain. You can spend an afternoon there. It is a worthwhile experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the most perfect hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Discerning_Travels04
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Istanbul at the Bosphorus is located on a piece of paradise. Overlooking the sea and still 15 minutes from great shopping and restaurants. My husband and I spent 3 days at the end of our 2 1/2 weeks in Turkey and Greece. It was a very special way to end our vacation. When we first arrived, we were offered an upgrade to a better view. However, this room was next to the elevator shaft which made constant and sudden stops and starts followed by a hum of the moving elevator. The hotel immediately switched us back to our street view room which was perfect. They changed our bedding as per our requests and continued to be prepared to do anything and everything to make our stay perfect throughout our 3 days. It is a shame that free internet or wifi is not a standard. We stayed in much lesser hotels that offered free internet and it was much appreciated. I do recommend getting off the somewhat sheltered grounds to discover the amazing culture of Istanbul. The food at the Four Seasons is delicious but not really Turkish, so be sure to try the 'kabops', dips and cheeses of Turkey, they are worth discovering.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rick5
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 3 hotels during a week in Istanbul and this is clearly the one to stay in. The outdoor pool right next to the river is priceless and the Four Seaons high standard's are preserved at all times (drinks offered, sunglass cleaning service, etc). The spa is excellent as well in case you need to regain some energy after a day of sight seeing. Overall the staff always really make the difference in the Four Seasons and here it is no exception. From the pool attendant to the concierge they are all absolutely first class!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: coops9999
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. 1st night, the room was not ideal (some traffic noise from the road with the view of a drainage ditch) - they moved us to a much nicer room, which we appreciated. * VERY friendly staff - it was a pleasure to stay here. * The pool is fabulous - perfect almost. Watching the tankers and pleasure craft zip by whilst swimming was great. Lot's of free smoothies and lemonade/water on tap. * Aqua restaurant was good, albeit in an "international" way. The Turkish wine was surprisingly good. * I slept like Rip van Winkle - the beds are super comfy * Business Centre has brand new Macs * Breakfast outside was lovely * Lunch on the terrace by the pool was good * We arranged an airport transfer (BMW 7-Series) - a good investment if it's hot (and the traffic's bad - which is always) * Spa is amazing - one of the best I've been to * Brilliant design - it's Turkish in style and executed to a very high standard The best hotel in Istanbul. Awesome. Don't stay anywhere else if you can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in all senses”
Reviews.Author: guillermohoter
Reviews.Content: Privileged location & convenient to all places you will want to visit. The architect in charge of creating this hotel has done a remarcable job. Although you may think the hotel is housed in a former palace, everything is new except the facade of the central building. The 2 side wings match nicely into an elegant complex facing a terrace directly on the sea. The rooms are large, the beds are superb, the marble bathroom very nice and the unique feature of a bow window with a build in Turkish sofa from which you can relax watching the ships negotiate the Bosphorus, is a fantastic creation. Marble, wood and design has been used in a refined way as to give a sense of quality avoiding any kitch. The Spa is of first quality and among the best I have seen ( Chewton Glen, Amstel Intercontinental, etc ). The outdoor pool and terrace could not be better. Said all this the most remarcable thing of this hotel is its staff. From the reception, to the room maids everybody is trained in such a way as to make you feel comfortable and with any need satisfied with a smile. I have seldom found such a consistent training. The Acqua restaurant is gourmet cuisine of the best class and serves an outstanding breakfast with above average choices.

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Sultan”
Reviews.Author: VoxVolpe
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all our expectations. It is an amazing Four Seasons property that has to be one of the most stunning Four Seasons properties we have ever stayed. The converted palace is beautiful, the fit and finish excellent and our Bosphorus view room amazing. The room was top notch in all ways and servie is what you would expect at a Four Seasons. The grounds and overall feel of the hotel mix the perfect balance of elegance and comfort. We enjoyed dinner at the restaurant with a stunning view of the Bosphorus and the skyline of Instanbul. The food was excellent the overall feel made us therefore feel special. I would recommned staying in the palace section of the hotel if possible, it is worth the cost. This is not a hotel but an experience.

Reviews.Title: “It is Four Seasons but in a magnificent location”
Reviews.Author: amankora
Reviews.Content: Four Seasons is Four Seasons. Spotlessly clean and maintained, elegantly furnished, nicely decorated, discreet but yet dedicated service, all what you expect from Four Seasons. However the location and terrace of this most beautiful and excellently managed property is spectacular. There are other hotels right on the Bosphorus but this one is the best. The terrace is a dream, whether you use the pool, sit by the water for drinks or dine in front of the restaurant, you can spend a day here and it is better than on any beach . The food at Acqua Restaurant is good and ambitous, some dishes come out perfect, (when they are Turkish influenced) others are a bit blend. Of course the meeting rooms, the spa etc. are spacious and elegant,most rooms have no view and definitely avoid the ones close to the street. It is a perfect city hotel for business or leisure and definitely the best in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A simply stunning hotel which provides...”
Reviews.Author: DistantTraveller1954
Reviews.Content: A simply stunning hotel which provides every facility in the most wonderful setting. The Spa is outstanding both in terms of scalable treatments and the architecture. Eating out on the terrace is a beautiful experience - we had a simply amazing meal.

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN ON THE BOSPHORUS”
Reviews.Author: rogi8
Reviews.Content: After flying from NYC the Four Seasons was perfect. Unfortunately our room wasn't available as it was 11am but they offered the spa to shower(which we didn't use) and recommended a nice square and restaurant for lunch, about a 15 minute walk. Unfortunately the weather wasn't ideal as it was cool and rainy but the room was available when we returned and was a good size and very luxurious. We had a garden view which probably wasn't as nice as the sea view but it wasn't worth the premium to us. The concierge recommended a place for dinner and made a reservation, which was average food and very overpriced (park fora) but they did give us a complete list of recommended restaurants and were helpful with advising us on how to see the sights. Since it was rainy the second afternoon after our full day touring we read in the beautiful lobby. We were lucky enough to have one day relaxing at the gorgeous pool on the bosphorus on our last day. They always have water for you, in the room, at the pool, and went above and beyond to make us welcome. There was even sun screen at the pool. They also made sure to give us something with the address and warn us if the taxi driver was taking a different route than the main road so we felt safe and weren't nervous. All and all an amazing hotel. The only negative is that the room was a little noisy in the morning with doors slamming, but we called it heaven!

Reviews.Title: “First class service, location not as good as the other Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: RSE2
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Four Seasons Istanbul at the Bosphorus. In some respects it is in sharp contrast to the Four Seasons at Sultanahmet (see separate review), in some respects more of the same. Firstly, the similarities. The service is wonderful throughout the hotel My wife commented that all the staff, from the bell hop to the manager, do genuinely appear to care, rather than parroting the endless platitudes that you get in some establishments. Now Iâ€™m sure that they are just well trained, but itâ€™s really very pleasant to feel that they care anyway. The food was similarly excellent. The buffet breakfast recommended, if highly expensive. The style of the Bosphorus hotel is somewhat different to the converted prison at Sultanahmet. Having only opened relatively recently, and being based on an old palace, it should come as no surprise that it feels bright and shiny and new. Every thing is perfect - although we witnessed the flower pots being repainted on our second day - and the decor is considerably more contemporary than the Sultanahmet property. To be honest it felt somewhat colder and less welcoming on arrival, but after a day or so we had got used to the slightly glitzier feel, the oversized television, and the â€œnew moneyâ€� look and feel, and relaxed into the whole Four Seasons experience. Our room was spacious, bathroom well equipped with bath, separate shower, and as much Lâ€™Occitane toiletries as you can stuff in your bag. The hotel is better equipped than Sultanahmet, being larger and having bigger grounds. The outdoor pool is suitable warm despite the air temperature being only 15-20â€˜C during our visit, and is large enough for swimming lengths. The gym is well equipped with TechnoGym kit, and was almost empty. The indoor pool is â€œexactly like we want at homeâ€� according to my wife, with dark tiles (rather than the ubiquitous bright blue) and a substantial adjoining spa. The location of the Bosphorus hotel is not as good as Sultanahmet. You are not really that close to anything albeit taxis in Istanbul are cheap and easy to use - although surprisingly many of the drivers do not (at least pretend not to) speak English. We dined at Topaz restaurant one night (which is highly recommended), and Feriye the next evening (wonderful location but I felt the food was a disappointment). There are also numerous trendy nightclubs further along the Bosphorus further out of Istanbul if that is your bag. In summary the Four Seasons Istanbul at the Bosphorus is a tasteful, stylish, swish, yet sympathetic renewal of an ancient Istanbul palace. The facilities are excellent. The location average, but with great views over the Bosphorus. The service remains peerless. EUR20 a day for WiFi is still outrageous - although again I tapped into someone elseâ€™s for free. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend either (or both) properties if you are visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Top international luxury hotel, best in Istanbul !”
Reviews.Author: OLV_P
Reviews.Content: The FOUR SEASONS Bosphorus houses a unique top class luxrury SPA, with treatments and decor inspired by centuries old traditions dating back to the Otoman Empire. Covering over 2000 sqm, the SPA includes a large indoor pool, 10 treatment rooms, 2 traditional hammams, steam rooms, saunas and a spectacular outdoor pool overlooking the Bosphorus. The interior design of the hotel is all about extreme good taste, understated, yet luxurious, blending modern designs with traditional Turkish and Oriental touches. The web site of the hotel hardly captures the incredible cozyness, quietness and warmth of the hotel. The feeling instilled is palatial, guests being equally treated as royals. One of the most impressive aspects of the hotel is its flower decorations, which adorne all public spaces. They are impressive not only in selection and colours but also in the actual design and layout, some lobby flower arrangements equalling those of the George V, Four Seasons's international flagship hotel. Irrespective of category, all rooms feature: hand painted ceilings in beuatiful pastel colours, large oriental mirrors, wooden floors, large bathrooms with several Oriental touches such as a Turkish rug and very subtle night lights. All rooms feature automatic curtains and most comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Bebe38
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for his birthday, and we loved the hotel. Had a large room overlooking the bosphorus, which I think is worth the extra cost. At night, lying in bed with the boats going by to far continents.....magical. We loved the location - the old town is too busy and noisy for our taste, and this was an easy taxi ride. We arranged for the hotel boat to take us up the Bosphorus with a stop for dinner on the far side - highly recommended. And it's true, the hotel doesn't have local charm, but which Four Seasons does? You don't go to the Four Seasons for local charm, you go for reliability, luxury and service. Istanbul delivers.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: Rui C
Reviews.Content: This place is beatufull to relaxation, shopping, culture................................................

Reviews.Title: “It can only be the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: fionette72
Reviews.Content: Great rooms and grounds... absolutely loved it! Saw a huge entourage of an Arab royal family there as well, hundreds of luggages lined up upon their arrival.. amazing~!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime....”
Reviews.Author: Mel1Sydney
Reviews.Content: This is, quite simply, one of the loveliest hotels we have ever stayed in â€“ and we have stayed in many (one of the others was the FS in Budapest). We called FS in desperation after one night in Istanbul, as the hotel we were in was too depressing. We went from dark and dingy to divine! Yes, it is a bit out of the way. Yes, it is expensive. Yes, it is also a bit too big. But what a gorgeous place! Opened about 18 months ago, it has an expansive and beautifully designed terrace running the full length of the hotel on the water line. After a full day of sightseeing and crowds, it was heaven to sit there in the late afternoon, seeing the sun set over the minarets in the distance, sipping a bloody mary and watching the busy water traffic on the Bosphorous. The staff is perfect. Everyone called us by name; the young and charismatic restaurant manager spent Â½ hour with us and a map, recommending sightseeing activities, restaurants and cafes. He knew almost more than the concierges! Really, I cannot rave about this hotel enough. You should know, however, that we are 5 star hotel people. There is a FS at the Sultanhamet, which was full when we originally booked. So I then booked the best suite at the Best Western President in the Sultanhamet area due to location, thinking it would be fine (have posted a review), but not for us. It calls itself 4 stars but itâ€™s not even close and I was foolish to think a BW could be. The Four Seasons Sultanhamet is much more central than the Bosphoros FS. Itâ€™s also apparently much more of a boutique hotel (converted from an old prison). However, for us, escaping the Best Western and walking out onto that terrace (see my photos!), having a hammam (Turkish bath) in their fantastic spa together with my husband, having the indoor pool for our daughterâ€¦well, it was just perfect. The ONLY complaint is that itâ€™s not possible to walk to any of the fabulous sites. But donâ€™t take a cab all the way into the Sultanhamet area, youâ€™ll be stuck in traffic for ages and get ripped off. Take a cab to the Enimou area (the port and new mosque), which is 5 minutes drive from the FS via a direct road, and there get on the tram to the Old City. There is only one tram lineâ€¦.up and down. You buy a token before you get on (you need it to enter the turnstile), itâ€™s about 1.50 Turkish lira per token and it doesnâ€™t matter how far you go â€“ one stop or 5 â€“ itâ€™s the same price. This hotel made our stay in Istanbul a wonderful memory (sun shine helps, too!). We had the cheapest room, Garden View (bit of a fudge, it was a view of the driveway but that is nicely landscaped!). It was huge (because it was a corner room # 3207) with an excellent and very large bathroom: tub, separate shower (big enough for two people!) and separate toilet. Plenty of closet space and many drawers, huge flat screen TV, big comfortable bed, bottle of water placed by the bed each night during turn-down service. Coffee machine (free); each morning we asked for warm milk for our coffee and it came within minutes. They also did an amazing job shining my slightly scruffy boots overnight (free). Newspaper (free). Wifi is NOT free, and this is one of my beefs about good hotels. It seems the more you spend in a hotel, the more you pay for internet connection. However, there is a business centre with 3 computers where you can access the internet for free. Every time my daughter and I went down there, we had no trouble getting a computer each. Can you tell we loved this hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious but lacking charm”
Reviews.Author: topsmed
Reviews.Content: A regular visitor to Istanbul, I was looking forward to staying at this FS, and I was a little disappointed. The location is good for some sights, especially Dolmabahce, the lovely Yildiz Park (almost across the street), Istanbul Modern, the boat terminal for the Princes' Islands, lively Besiktas (a few hundred meters from the hotel and a great place for an evening stroll). The hotel itself is on a busy stretch of Ciragan Street, with an ugly driveway leading to the entrance, and you feel disconnected from Istanbul life. The hotel caters to large groups and hosts many functions (there was a loud corporate party on the terrace one day), so it does not feel intimate at all. I had a Palace Garden room, but choosing the right room is difficult here. The original building has higher ceilings and more light but it does not really feel like an Ottoman palace (too much renovation), and the regular rooms are not very big and terribly expensive. Suites in the palace are great but I am not sure they are worth 3000 euro+ per night. The less expensive rooms with a "garden view" look out mostly to the busy driveway with the buses, taxis and limos. The new wings look too modern, the rooms have lower ceilings and smallish windows, and only a few suites have a view to the Bosphorus. On the positive side, the room had the very high standard of comfort that comes with FS, the bar was a great place to unwind in the evening with live music, and breakfast at Aqua was a superb buffet. Service was good but not exceptional and feeling a little corporate. The highlight of the hotel, besides the terrace overlooking the Bosphorus, was the spa area, one of the best I have seen in a city hotel (although I was not impressed by the treatment in the traditional hammam). My conclusion is that this is a great business hotel with very expensive rooms, but I would stay elsewhere on my next romantic stay in the city, either at Les Ottomans in chic Kurucesme (also horribly expensive) for a more authentic "palace on the Bosphorus" experience or in Beyoglu (see my review of Tomtom Suites, which I enjoyed more than the FS).

Reviews.Title: “Among the best i have ever seen (and I've seen many)”
Reviews.Author: Dirk3061
Reviews.Content: Superb location; not the usual big anonymus building but mor like a (large) boutique hotel. Classy !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: kag1889
Reviews.Content: The hotel common spaces are just beautiful, all outdoor spaces, pool, restaurant ect. overlook the Bosphorus and everything is done perfectly. The pool and spa are gorgeous and it is a delight eating breakfast watching the boats go by and seeing the scenery of the coast. The location of the hotel is out of the way for most sightseeing and I think it will be more frequented by business travelers. The other Four Seasons although much less opulent is in the heart of where it is all happening and in walking distance to the most important sightseeing. I was less impressed with the room than the common area. I found the room, deluxe palace with garden view to be small and it only had a view of the front entrance. All of this said I would imagine that this is the most luxurious hotel in Istanbul without the best service. Forgot to mention that it has the best gym I have ever seen in a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel thanks to its location”
Reviews.Author: slecombre
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel well worth the price. A great location with a unique view on the bosphorus from the restaurant, the swimmingpool and the garden. It is a pleasure having a greta breakfast in from of the river, you are so close to water your have the feeling to float on the water. Service with a smile, efficient staff always eager to help. I loved the 1-hour pressing service and the complementary shoe-shine. Those kind of details ease your business trip. Only minor downsides, the room (basic garden view) is great but the view on the entrance of cars is not great. I would strongly recommand to book a room with a view on the Bosphorous. Food is not the best I had in a luxury hotel, was disappointed by my dinner at the bar (restaurant service was closed). Anyway, I would recommand this hotel to anyone, especially leisure traveller that will have time to enjoy the place.

Reviews.Title: “Corporate perfection”
Reviews.Author: TrophyCollector
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful example of Four Seasons corporate perfection. Everything is the way it should be, but yet the hotel misses the one little ingredient that I personally hope to find in local "Nr. 1 hotels": atmoshere / aura /soul created by a sophisticated local / foreign visitor mix - and a tastefully warm interior. In that respect the "Kempinski Ciragan Palace" still beats the 4S. In terms of view, the "Conrad" (executive floor) still beats the 4S. In terms of plush luxury, doesn't the "Les Ottomans" offer all the same, but better - and more expensive - than the 4S? It is so hard to decide in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: na9101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from 8/4-8/7/09. Hotel is brand new and definitely looks it. The staff was very helpful and accomodating. Great views of the Bosphorus. They have both an inddor & outdoor pool. Only tried the outdoor and it was great. We had informed them that it was our honeymoon and they defintiely took care of us. Roses, candles, the works. Definitely a great hotel and we'll look to stay here again when back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Could improve in some areas, pleasant stay though”
Reviews.Author: Virtualadvisor
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the new wings. Make sure you keep to the same lift as they go to different parts of the hotel. Room spacious but very beige, including a beige carpet (not what I was expecting in a country famed for its carpets) with a damp area that was not remedied during the stay. No apology either. The rooms could do with some splashes of colour in the decor. Good size TV though Pay TV did not appear to be available. Adaptor provided in drawer. Chipped spout (!!!) on the teapot for room service breakfast, though at least it had tea leaves and a strainer. Only enough butter for one slice of toast. The extra butter I asked for didn't arrive. I returned at 9 pm and turndown had not been done - Housekeeping said it went on until 11 pm so ask for 'early' turndown if you have young children. Staff by pool area were not forthcoming in offering drinks and didn't clean the table next to me and no snacks were available after 5 at the pool. So, not quite a five star experience all round, in my opinion. Laundry service was good, as was the food at Aqua, the restaurant. Floor was slippery with a puddle of water by the fountain near the spa entrance and the poolside by the indoor pool was also slippery - my children slipped in both areas. Hair salon next to the spa. Good view of the Bosphorus. Good pool with underwater music. I will go back to Istanbul but will be considering alternative hotels.

Reviews.Title: “No great Turkish delight......”
Reviews.Author: Serial_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews - I'd had high hopes - but staying at this new Four Seasons on the Bosphorus has actually put me off wanting to stay at Four Seasons properties again. I'm now going back to basics and looking for boutique hotels with charm and atmosphere. It's true the original part of this property is rather grand, though the majority of the bedrooms are in two annexes which have as much design integrity as a 1970's Holiday Inn. Our room, granted, was once of the cheaper ones on offer, however I don't think 500 Euros a night exactly a bargain. And again, it was so ordinary in design that it lacked charm and could have been anywhere on the planet. It further bugged me to learn that the hotel was virtually empty yet they couldn't have stuck us further away - and after having spent countless thousands of pounds at this chain over the years, I think they could have found something nicer for us - though of course, one must remember The Four Seasons is now a franchise just like McDonalds, so no longer does it have that intimate special feel, and no longer do they appear to look at your past record of staying with them - now, you're just a number. However, the main reason I don't want to stay at a Four Seasons hotel again is the beds. I absolutely loathe these bizarre mattresses that have step like layers to them, as well as mattress toppers, so the second you lay down you feel like you're drowning in a huge sponge that gives me back pain. Admittedly I prefer a firm hard mattress, and it seems the Four Seasons are unable to accommodate a guest that wants that type of bed. However, the 5 nights I stayed here were a nightmare sleep wise, so I was moody all day craving a quite area to sleep by the pool. And yes, before you ask, I did request all the unnecessary layers of the bed were removed - and eventually they were after a third or fourth attempt - however it didn't make much difference. Pluses - dinner served in the Aqua restaurant was very good - and the best food we ate in Istanbul. Breakfast is also very good if there are not too many guests around. Come the weekend when there's an influx of new arrivals everything went a bit pear-shaped. But there are some very good professional staff on duty. Maybe given time they'll get used to the weekend crowd that pours in. After one half-day of touring the sights we got back to the hotel for a late lunch around 3pm, we ordered a Club Sandwich - and 45 minutes later we discovered they'd lost our order and simply forgotten about us, even though our waiter had us within his vision at all times. At 4.30 we got something to eat. Sorry, this isn't acceptable in a proper 5* Four Seasons. On our last night, after an excellent dinner, in a virtually empty restaurant, we had to repeatedly ask for the bill, which finally arrived after I had to raise my voice just under 30 minutes later. We originally arrived on a Friday - and on Friday and Saturday evening after dinner it was really nice to sit outside with a bottle of wine and watch the river traffic pass by. And there's a great young waiter who will make sure you're warm by giving you a wrap, and position Propane heaters around you. But come Sunday all the outdoor furniture is removed, no heaters - nothing. Odd, no? Either you offer a service to your guests or you don't. Don't give one day, and take away the next! These may seem like petty gripes - but when you've not slept properly in a room that's costing you 500 Euros a night you expect everything else to run perfectly. One should also be aware - though it's no fault of the hotel - that getting anywhere from this property takes ages due to the ridiculous high volume of traffic that passes the entrance to the hotel. I'm not sure if I'll bother going back to Istanbul as I feel the whole trip was a waste of money - however, if I do venture back I will most definitely look for a small boutique property that makes me feel like I'm in Turkey - where I feel it's acceptable for there to be mishaps - and I'm not paying a fortune at the end of it. So, upon leaving, and being 4 grand out of pocket I couldn't wait to get back home and have a decent nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic view in all of Europe”
Reviews.Author: sebnemnyc
Reviews.Content: As soon as I stepped foot in the Four Seasons at the Bosphorus, I knew it would be a truly special stay. Having been born in Istanbul, I couldn't help but feel at home. The views are completely breathtaking, whether you're sipping tea [on the most comfortable couches overlooking the city] during the day or having a cocktail at night, the view is like no other in the world. The food and service is top notch. Poolside during the day, there is a server who comes around specifically to clean your sunglasses! I was so completely surprised when I picked up my book and found that housekeeping had left a bookmark where I left off! No detail is left untouched and it doesn't go unnoticed. Aside from the obiviously beautiful architecture, Four Seasons is just a short taxi ride to Topkapi Palace, Istineye Park, the Grand Bazaar and my favorite - Reina. Oh, and taxi's are cheap, safe and conveniently at the main entrance of the hotel. I can go and on about this property and Istanbul itself but I will spare you, however, I will tell you if you are considering visiting Istanbul - this is where it's at.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the best”
Reviews.Author: ssamra
Reviews.Content: I along with my wife and our younger son(15 yrs) stayed at Four Seasons from June 19, 2009 for 3 nights. We checked in early and our room was ready on our arrival and to our surprise we were upgraded to a suite.The location of the hotel is amazing and our first impression of the same was much better than what we expected. Outdoor sitting of the restaurant Aqua along the Bosphorus was breathtaking and we really enjoyed light meals and breakfast . Each and every staff member of the hotel were giving their best making our stay all the more enjoyable. Experiencing Turkish Hamam at Spa was great. Every other facility is available at doorstep. I strongly recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking for similar kind of accommodation in Istanbul and would love to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: KeithLafayette
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this is the finest hotel I have ever stayed in. I was here for four nights at the beginning of June and stayed in one of the "Bosphorus Suites," which consisted of a foyer, powder room, living room, bedroom and nice two sink bathroom. It was, of course, spotless and impeccable (though it was a little dark because the windows were a bit small). The hotel itself was stunning inside and out. There is nothing better than sitting on the large outdoor patio along the river sipping a nice glass of wine while watching the ships go by on the Bosphorus. The restaurant (where we had breakfast and lunch but not dinner) was very good. I am attaching a picture of my very tasty mezze platter lunch, which I had two days in a row. The staff was also wonderful, especially the concierges. If you have an opportunity to stay here, you must.

Reviews.Title: “No Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: EWLTexas
Reviews.Content: At over $800 per night at the Four Seasons Bosporus, we were disappointed to find that our room did not have a river view. When we arrived we were told that such views are available mainly in the main building â€œPalace Bosporusâ€� rooms at more than $1,000 per night! As we were led to our room in one of the side wings, the receptionist pointed to the hallway window framing the river view and said â€œIsnâ€™t it beautifulâ€�, then led us halfway down the hall to a room overlooking a scruffy vacant lot where the only glimpse of the river could be had by sitting on the bay window seat and stretching to look out. The room itself was spacious and comfortable, but decorated in a bland, modern manner that could have been anywhere in the world. Earlier in the trip we spent five nights at the Four Seasons Sultanahmet in Istanbulâ€™s old city and were delighted with its Turkish charm. There we had a suite with separate sitting area and powder room (as well as a full bathroom) for $100 less per night. As always, the Four Seasons staff was charming and professional with good English skills. The ample buffet breakfast on a geranium lined terrace overlooking the river was delightful. The pool area and spa are quite beautiful. It was great fun to sit by the pool and watch the busy river traffic go by.

Reviews.Title: “Could spend years looking at the Bosphorus here!”
Reviews.Author: gp2008Mumbai
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons by the Bosphorus was a relatively new hotel- when I went there on business. Everything is typically Foru Seasons- post modern, functional. But God, oh God, the view of the Bosphorus is to die for. My favourite place is the pool deck and mini restuarant by the Bosphorus where there are the most breathtaking views of the water and some of the lovely houses down the Bay. The Hotel also arranges boat rides on the waters with the works-champagne, Turkish music and a guide. Very Venetian in feel! Just missed the fact that there were no balcony rooms overlooking the waters like the Ciragan and felt the menu could have more representation of local delicacies ,werent adequately represented at all. Services like the Turkish hammam are quite expectedly expensive (EUR 100 or so)

Reviews.Title: “Yes, yes, yes!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinn
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided exactly what it says in the website: Four Seasons promises twice the best of Istanbul. This included beatiful public spaces, a wonderful terass for breakfast etc, an superbly elegant pool area, polite and friendly service. It really kind of improved the also otherwise fantastic stay in a fabulous city. The rooms facing the inner yard do not have a much of a vista, neither the ones facing toward the (old and beautiful) nearby school building. However, the terass has a wonderful view of Bosphorus, so it's not a big deal. The part of the town is not ideal for sightseeing the old town, but otherwise Besictas and Nisantasi are nice areas with shops and restaurants. Do also take a waterbus to ÃœskÃ¼dar, and then bus or taxi to Beylerbeyi, where you can visit the summer palace of the Ottoman sultans and have wonderful fish in the open air restaurants. (And even take a hammam bath: relaxing, if a bit primitive setting). We visited the hotel as a part of the package including the both Four Seasons in the town. The hotel took care of our luggage, when swithcing, we just needed to find our way there after another nice day in the city. I also tried a limo transport in both ways: fun/worth the money: they even do the security check of the luggage and the check-in for you!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Location. Superb Service.”
Reviews.Author: thesceptic
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, a stone's throw from the Ciragan Palace. The location and exteriors are superb, incredible setting on the Bosphorus, with a lovely pool and huge and gorgeous terrace. The service is everything that you could expect, and more. Only negative: the rooms are unexceptional (very good, but nothing remarkable).

Reviews.Title: “Superb luxury resort hotel on the banks of the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: TM99
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this property, so stayed in late May, when the weather was perfect - sunny and warm. The location of this hotel on the banks of the Bosphorus is gorgeous and glamorous. The hotel photos do not do the marble terrace, crammed with scarlet geraniums, off-set by the blue water any justice. I never tired of this divine position and view - it was bliss at breakfast, lunch and dinner, as well as whenever we took a break from sightseeing to simply laze by the pool. The hotel is very luxurious and immaculate. Service is impeccable throughout, including attentive poolside service, with frequent offerings of cool drinks, sunglass cleaning etc. We started our trip at the Four Seasons' Sultanahmet property and I would highly recommend combining the two, especially if you are visiting Istanbul in good weather when you will really appreciate the outside space offered at the Bosphorus. For sight-seeing, the Bosphorus location is as good as at many of the other 5 star hotels (as many of them are nearby) but you can't beat Sultanahmet for that! We used the Concierge several times for restaurant recommendations - we always got one of the best tables and each recommendation was absolutely what we had asked for, so 10 out of 10! Also we asked if it would be possible to get a late checkout, as our flight left early evening. The reception team honoured this for us, without my even needing to check with them first - they called me the day before to confirm that it would be fine. I felt that the staff went out of their way to give my family a very enjoyable holiday and I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: bbfamilyDubai
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel. It is one of the best I have ever stayed in. The location is amazing, service and accommodation first class and the attention to detail is superb. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to explore Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: LuxTravelLover
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for part of our honeymoon. despite the fact that it was only a wee after the hotel opened (late June 2008), everything was fantastic. Beautiful setting right on the Bosphorus and while it is a little bit out of town, it's a short taxi or boat ride to the main attractions of Istanbul. The spa is gorgeous, gym well equipped, and the food was top notch. Also, as another reviewer noted, the pool side service was wonderful. I don't think you can go wrong with a four seasons and certainly not this one!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection on the Bospherous”
Reviews.Author: RLB_NYC
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous hotel: truly every corner is perfect, pristine and lovely. First rate service, gorgeous spa, truly magnificent. The very meaning of 5 star. Try to get a room in the main palace section rather than the new wings. Good location, walk to other hotels, hip neighborhood, the ferry to Asia - not the best location to see the typical sights (i.e. Hagia Sofia, etc. - stay in the other Four Seasons Istanbul for that) but a relaxing reprieve from the touristy center of Istanbul. Suggest staying a few nights on the Bospherous, a few nights at the other Four Seasons in the city. The hotel will set up a boat tour of the Bospherous complete with mezze and wine - pricy but worth it. My only qualm is that in its utter perfection, it's a little "cold" - not reflective of the country itself. But I'm not complaining. Go to Les Ottomans, another hotel a few blocks down, for cocktails - tons of fun, crazy decor. The pool looked amazing and I'm sure the summer scene is tons of fun, though we were there during the fall and it was chilly and overcast.

Reviews.Title: “Clearly the best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MDR04
Reviews.Content: Well, this is a Four Seasons, so what would you expect. But this is truely a beautiful hotel. The location in terms of views is amazing, but you will need to travel to go the key sites of Istanbul - but a water taxi service makes that quite fun. Everything really is impressive here, I really couldnt fault it - other than - the weather which was horrible (but what do you expect for early March) and that I was on business. If I could afford it I would return when the sun is out and stay for some time. Lastly the spa has to be one of the best in the world and would predict it make conde nast's list of the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location and world class service hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: CitybreakWestcountry
Reviews.Content: With its Spa the Four Seasons Istanbul at the Bosphorus is set to be a world class Spa Hotel. The Staff were outstanding. Location stunning with a quick hop by boat to the old town. Real charm yet all mod cons available. A Spa to rival its sister hotel the Four Seasons in Sharm El Sheikh. Worth checking out of season rates. If the sun shines take to the Bosphorus and head up towards the Black Sea. Byzantium, Constantinople, Istanbul - a stunning history unfolds before your eyes.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: searchandapply
Reviews.Content: This hotel made my trip to Istanbul. I would only return if I could stay at this hotel. The pool had private cabanas where I slept for hours. At the pool, they washed our sunglasses, gave foot massages, brought smoothie drinks. The service was impeccable. The food at the pool was also 5 star. Great gym with many tvs at each station. I never made it to the spa but the entrance looked grand. The rooms were what you would expect of Four Seasons but then that much better. Every night there was a different wedding on property and while oru room was on the 4th floor they never disturbed us. We also had fireworks each night overlooking the Bosphorous. I will return to Istanbul, only to stay at this hotel.
